2187
2188#endif
2189
2190// try to find file fnm in one of the include paths -- returns complete path to file
2191StringtaString taMisc::FindFileOnPath(String_PArray& paths, const char* fname) {
2192 int acc = access(fname, F_OK0);
2193 if (acc == 0) {
2194 return fname;
2195 }
2196
2197 for(int i=0; i<paths.size; i++) {
2198 StringtaString trynm = paths.FastEl(i) + "/" + fname;
2199 int acc = access(trynm, F_OK0);
2200 if (acc == 0) {
2201 return trynm;
2202 }
2203 }
2204 return "";
2205}
2206
2207StringtaString taMisc::FindFileOnLoadPath(const char* fname) {
2208 return FindFileOnPath(load_paths, fname);
2209}
2210
2211int taMisc::GetUniqueFileNumber(int st_no, const StringtaString& prefix, const StringtaString& suffix) {
2212 StringtaString fname;
2213 int i;
2214 for(i=st_no; i<10000; i++) { // stop at 10,000
2215 fname = prefix + StringtaString(i) + suffix;
2216 int acc = access(fname, R_OK4);
2217 if(acc != 0)
2218 break; // its ok..
2219 }
2220 fstream strm;
2221 strm.open(fname, ios::out); // this should hold the place for the file
2222 strm.close(); strm.clear(); // while it is being saved, etc..
2223 return i;
2224}
2225
2226StringtaString taMisc::FileDiff(const StringtaString& fname_a, const StringtaString& fname_b,
2227 bool trimSpace, bool ignoreSpace, bool ignoreCase) {
2228 StringtaString str_a, str_b;
2229 taStringDiff diff;
2230 diff.DiffFiles(fname_a, fname_b, str_a, str_b, trimSpace, ignoreSpace, ignoreCase);
2231 return diff.GetDiffStr(str_a, str_b);
2232}
2233
2234StringtaString taMisc::GetWikiURL(const StringtaString& wiki_name, bool add_index) {
2235 Variant rval = wikis.GetVal(wiki_name);
2236 if(rval.isNull()) return _nilStringtaString();
2237 StringtaString url = rval.toString();
2238 if(add_index)
2239 url += "/index.php/";
2240 return url;
2241}
2242
2243StringtaString taMisc::FixURL(const StringtaString& urltxt) {
2244 StringtaString nwurl = urltxt;
2245 // This is not a fix, it's breakage: it prevents using relative URLs to
2246 // link to pages stored in the same directory as the project file.
2247 // if(!urltxt.contains(':') && !urltxt.startsWith('.')) {
2248 // nwurl = String("http://") + urltxt; // assume http as default
2249 // }
2250 if(nwurl.startsWith("http://")) { // now fixup http links..
2251 if(!nwurl.contains('.')) nwurl += ".com"; // assume .com
2252 }
2253 return nwurl;
2254}
2255
2256StringtaString taMisc::ExtraAppSuffix() {
2257 if(app_suffix.empty()) return app_suffix;
2258 StringtaString rval = app_suffix;
2259 // remove standard suffixes
2260 rval.gsub("_dbg", "");
2261 rval.gsub("_mpi", "");
2262 return rval;
2263}
2264
2265
2266bool taMisc::InternetConnected() {
2267 bool any_valid = false;
2268#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
2269 const bool DEBUG_LOG = false;
2270 QList<QNetworkInterface> ifaces = QNetworkInterface::allInterfaces();
2271 if (DEBUG_LOG) cerr << "Inspecting network interfaces..." << endl;
2272 for (int i = 0; i < ifaces.size(); ++i) {
2273 if (DEBUG_LOG) cerr << " Looking at interface #" << i << endl;
2274 const QNetworkInterface& ifc = ifaces.at(i);
2275 if(!ifc.isValid()) {
2276 if (DEBUG_LOG) cerr << " Skipping, not valid" << endl;
2277 continue;
2278 }
2279 if(ifc.flags() & (QNetworkInterface::IsLoopBack | QNetworkInterface::IsPointToPoint)) {
2280 if (DEBUG_LOG) cerr << " Skipping, isloopback or ptp" << endl;
2281 continue;
2282 }
2283 if(ifc.flags() & (QNetworkInterface::IsRunning | QNetworkInterface::IsUp)) {
2284
2285 QList<QNetworkAddressEntry> addrs = ifc.addressEntries();
2286 if(addrs.size() == 0) {
2287 if (DEBUG_LOG) cerr << " Skipping, addrs.size()==0" << endl;
2288 continue;
2289 }
2290
2291 StringtaString nm = ifc.name();
2292 if(nm.startsWith("vm")) {
2293 // This check isn't necessarily reliable: a VirtualBox VM
2294 // interface may be named with a GUID.
2295 if (DEBUG_LOG) cerr << " Skipping, VM name: " << nm << endl;
2296 continue; // avoid virtual machine guys!
2297 }
2298 for (int j = 0; j < addrs.size(); ++j) {
2299 QHostAddress ip = addrs.at(j).ip();
2300 if(ip.isNull()) {
2301 if (DEBUG_LOG) cerr << " Skipping address #" << j << ", IP is null" << endl;
2302 }
2303 else {
2304 StringtaString adr = ip.toString();
2305 if (DEBUG_LOG) cerr << " Up and running: " << nm << " with addr:" << adr << endl;
2306 any_valid = true;
2307 // could break/return here, but for logging purposes, keep going.
2308 }
2309 }
2310 }
2311 else
2312 {
2313 if (DEBUG_LOG) cerr << "intf #" << i << " is not up" << endl;
2314 }
2315 }
2316#endif
2317 return any_valid;
2318}
2319
2320int taMisc::ExecuteCommand(const StringtaString& cmd) {
2321 return system(cmd);
2322}
2323
2324/////////////////////////////////////////////////
2325// Recording GUI actions to css script
2326
2327void taMisc::StartRecording(ostream* strm){
2328 record_script = strm;
2329 if (ScriptRecordingGui_Hook)
2330 ScriptRecordingGui_Hook(true);
2331}
2332
2333void taMisc::StopRecording(){
2334 record_script = NULL__null;
2335 if (ScriptRecordingGui_Hook)
2336 ScriptRecordingGui_Hook(false);
2337}
2338
2339bool taMisc::RecordScript(const char* cmd) {
2340 if (record_script == NULL__null)
2341 return false;
2342 if (record_script->bad() || record_script->eof()) {
2343 taMisc::Warning("*** Error: recording script is bad or eof, no script command recorded!!",
2344 cmd);
2345 return false;
2346 }
2347 *record_script << cmd;
2348 if(cmd[strlen(cmd)-1] != '\n') {
2349 taMisc::Warning("*** Warning: cmd must end in a newline, but doesn't -- should be fixed:",
2350 cmd);
2351 *record_script << '\n';
2352 }
2353 record_script->flush();
2354 return true;
2355}
2356
2357#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
2358// normal non quoted members
2359void taMisc::ScriptRecordAssignment(taBase* tab,MemberDef* md){
2360 if(taMisc::record_script != NULL__null) {
2361 *taMisc::record_script << tab->GetPathNames() << "." << md->name << " = " <<
2362 md->type->GetValStr(md->GetOff(tab)) << ";" << endl;
2363 }
2364}
2365// Script Record Inline Assignment
2366void taMisc::SRIAssignment(taBase* tab,MemberDef* md){
2367 if(taMisc::record_script != NULL__null) {
2368 *taMisc::record_script << tab->GetPathNames() << "." << md->name << " = \"" <<
2369 md->type->GetValStr(md->GetOff(tab)) << "\";\n";
2370 *taMisc::record_script << tab->GetPathNames() << "." << "UpdateAfterEdit();" << endl;
2371 }
2372}
2373
2374// Script Record Enum Assignment
2375void taMisc::SREAssignment(taBase* tab,MemberDef* md){
2376 if(taMisc::record_script != NULL__null) {
2377 *taMisc::record_script << tab->GetPathNames() << "." << md->name << " = " <<
2378 tab->GetTypeDef()->name << "::" <<
2379 md->type->GetValStr(md->GetOff(tab)) << ";" << endl;
2380 }
2381}
2382#endif
2383
2384////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2385// File Parsing Stuff for Dump routines
2386
2387int taMisc::skip_white(istream& strm, bool peek) {
2388 int c;
2389 if(taMisc::verbose_load >= taMisc::SOURCE) {
2390 while (((c=strm.peek()) == ' ') || (c == '\t') || (c == '\n') || (c == '\r')) {
2391 strm.get();
2392 ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2393 }
2394 if(!peek && (c != EOF(-1))) ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2395 }
2396 else {
2397 while (((c=strm.peek()) == ' ') || (c == '\t') || (c == '\n') || (c == '\r'))
2398 strm.get();
2399 }
2400 if(!peek)
2401 strm.get();
2402 return c;
2403}
2404
2405int taMisc::skip_white_noeol(istream& strm, bool peek) {
2406 int c;
2407 if(taMisc::verbose_load >= taMisc::SOURCE) {
2408 while (((c=strm.peek()) == ' ') || (c == '\t') || (c == '\r')) {
2409 strm.get();
2410 ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2411 }
2412 if(!peek && (c != EOF(-1))) ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2413 }
2414 else {
2415 while (((c=strm.peek()) == ' ') || (c == '\t') || (c == '\r'))
2416 strm.get();
2417 }
2418 if(!peek)
2419 strm.get();
2420 return c;
2421}
2422
2423int taMisc::read_word(istream& strm, bool peek) {
2424 int c = skip_white(strm, true); // use peek mode
2425 LexBuf = "";
2426 if(taMisc::verbose_load >= taMisc::SOURCE) {
2427 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && (isalnum(c) || (c == '_'))) {
2428 ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2429 LexBuf += (char)c; strm.get();
2430 }
2431 if(c != EOF(-1)) ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2432 }
2433 else {
2434 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && (isalnum(c) || (c == '_'))) {
2435 LexBuf += (char)c; strm.get();
2436 }
2437 }
2438 if(!peek)
2439 strm.get();
2440 return c;
2441}
2442
2443int taMisc::read_nonwhite(istream& strm, bool peek) {
2444 int c = skip_white(strm, true);
2445 LexBuf = "";
2446 if(taMisc::verbose_load >= taMisc::SOURCE) {
2447 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && (c!=' ') && (c!='\t') && (c!='\n') && (c!='\r')) {
2448 ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2449 LexBuf += (char)c; strm.get();
2450 }
2451 if(c != EOF(-1)) ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2452 }
2453 else {
2454 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && (c!=' ') && (c!='\t') && (c!='\n') && (c!='\r')) {
2455 LexBuf += (char)c; strm.get();
2456 }
2457 }
2458 if(!peek)
2459 strm.get();
2460 return c;
2461}
2462
2463int taMisc::read_nonwhite_noeol(istream& strm, bool peek) {
2464 int c = skip_white_noeol(strm,true);
2465 taMisc::LexBuf = "";
2466 if(taMisc::verbose_load >= taMisc::SOURCE) {
2467 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && (c!=' ') && (c!='\t') && (c!='\n') && (c!='\r')) {
2468 ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2469 taMisc::LexBuf += (char)c; strm.get();
2470 }
2471 if(c != EOF(-1)) ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2472 }
2473 else {
2474 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && (c!=' ') && (c!='\t') && (c!='\n') && (c!='\r')) {
2475 taMisc::LexBuf += (char)c; strm.get();
2476 }
2477 }
2478 if(!peek)
2479 strm.get();
2480 return c;
2481}
2482
2483int taMisc::read_till_eol(istream& strm, bool peek) {
2484 int c = skip_white_noeol(strm, true);
2485 LexBuf = "";
2486 if(taMisc::verbose_load >= taMisc::SOURCE) {
2487 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && !((c == '\n'))) {
2488 ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2489 if(c != '\r') LexBuf += (char)c;
2490 strm.get();
2491 }
2492 if(c != EOF(-1)) ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2493 }
2494 else {
2495 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && !((c == '\n'))) {
2496 if(c != '\r') LexBuf += (char)c;
2497 strm.get();
2498 }
2499 }
2500 if(!peek)
2501 strm.get();
2502 return c;
2503}
2504
2505int taMisc::read_till_semi(istream& strm, bool peek) {
2506 int c = skip_white(strm, true);
2507 LexBuf = "";
2508 if(taMisc::verbose_load >= taMisc::SOURCE) {
2509 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && !((c == ';'))) {
2510 ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2511 LexBuf += (char)c; strm.get();
2512 }
2513 if(c != EOF(-1)) ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2514 }
2515 else {
2516 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && !((c == ';'))) {
2517 LexBuf += (char)c; strm.get();
2518 }
2519 }
2520 if(!peek)
2521 strm.get();
2522 return c;
2523}
2524
2525int taMisc::read_till_lbracket(istream& strm, bool peek) {
2526 int c = skip_white(strm, true);
2527 LexBuf = "";
2528 if(taMisc::verbose_load >= taMisc::SOURCE) {
2529 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && !((c == '{'))) {
2530 ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2531 LexBuf += (char)c; strm.get();
2532 }
2533 if(c != EOF(-1)) ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2534 }
2535 else {
2536 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && !((c == '{'))) {
2537 LexBuf += (char)c; strm.get();
2538 }
2539 }
2540 if(!peek)
2541 strm.get();
2542 return c;
2543}
2544
2545int taMisc::read_till_lb_or_semi(istream& strm, bool peek) {
2546 int c = skip_white(strm, true);
2547 LexBuf = "";
2548 if(taMisc::verbose_load >= taMisc::SOURCE) {
2549 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && !((c == '{') || (c == ';') || (c == '='))) {
2550 ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2551 LexBuf += (char)c; strm.get();
2552 }
2553 if(c != EOF(-1)) ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2554 }
2555 else {
2556 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && !((c == '{') || (c == ';') || (c == '='))) {
2557 LexBuf += (char)c; strm.get();
2558 }
2559 }
2560 if(!peek)
2561 strm.get();
2562 return c;
2563}
2564
2565int taMisc::read_till_rbracket(istream& strm, bool peek) {
2566 int c = skip_white(strm, true);
2567 LexBuf = "";
2568 int depth = 0;
2569 if(taMisc::verbose_load >= taMisc::SOURCE) {
2570 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && !((c == '}') && (depth <= 0))) {
2571 ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2572 LexBuf += (char)c;
2573 if(c == '{') depth++;
2574 if(c == '}') depth--;
2575 strm.get();
2576 }
2577 if(c != EOF(-1)) ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2578 }
2579 else {
2580 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && !((c == '}') && (depth <= 0))) {
2581 LexBuf += (char)c;
2582 if(c == '{') depth++;
2583 if(c == '}') depth--;
2584 strm.get();
2585 }
2586 }
2587 if(!peek)
2588 strm.get();
2589 return c;
2590}
2591
2592int taMisc::read_till_rb_or_semi(istream& strm, bool peek) {
2593 int c = skip_white(strm, true);
2594 LexBuf = "";
2595 int depth = 0;
2596 if(taMisc::verbose_load >= taMisc::SOURCE) {
2597 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && !(((c == '}') || (c == ';')) && (depth <= 0))) {
2598 ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2599 LexBuf += (char)c;
2600 if(c == '{') depth++;
2601 if(c == '}') depth--;
2602 strm.get();
2603 }
2604 if(c != EOF(-1)) ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2605 }
2606 else {
2607 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && !(((c == '}') || (c == ';')) && (depth <= 0))) {
2608 LexBuf += (char)c;
2609 if(c == '{') depth++;
2610 if(c == '}') depth--;
2611 strm.get();
2612 }
2613 }
2614 if(!peek) {
2615 strm.get();
2616 if((c == '}') && (strm.peek() == ';')) strm.get(); // skip next semi
2617 }
2618 return c;
2619}
2620
2621int taMisc::skip_till_start_quote_or_semi(istream& strm, bool peek) {
2622// read in the stream until a start quote or a semi
2623 int c = skip_white(strm, true);
2624 LexBuf = "";
2625 if(taMisc::verbose_load >= taMisc::SOURCE) {
2626 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && (c != '\"') && (c != ';')) {
2627 ConsoleOutputChars((char)strm.get(), true);
2628 }
2629 }
2630 else {
2631 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && (c != '\"') && (c != ';'))
2632 strm.get(); // consume it
2633 }
2634 if(!peek)
2635 strm.get();
2636 return c;
2637}
2638
2639
2640int taMisc::read_till_end_quote(istream& strm, bool peek) {
2641 // don't skip initial whitespace because we're presumably reading a string literal
2642 int c;
2643 bool bs = false;
2644 LexBuf = "";
2645 if (taMisc::verbose_load >= taMisc::SOURCE) {
2646 while (true) {
2647 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && (bs || ((c != '\"') && (c != '\\')) ) )
2648 { // "
2649 bs = false;
2650 ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2651 LexBuf += (char)c; strm.get();
2652 }
2653 if (c == EOF(-1)) break;
2654 //NOTE: don't echo escape chars
2655 if (c == '\\') {
2656 strm.get(); // get the backslash (don't put in LexBuf)
2657 bs = true; // backslash-quoted character coming
2658 } else // if (c == '\"')
2659 break;
2660 }
2661 }
2662 else {
2663 while (true) {
2664 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && (bs || ((c != '\"') && (c != '\\')))) { // "
2665 bs = false;
2666 LexBuf += (char)c; strm.get();
2667 }
2668 if (c == EOF(-1)) break;
2669 if (c == '\\') {
2670 strm.get(); // get the backslash (don't put in LexBuf)
2671 bs = true; // backslash-quoted character coming
2672 } else // if (c == '\"')
2673 break;
2674 }
2675 }
2676 if (!peek)
2677 strm.get(); // consume the "
2678 return c;
2679}
2680
2681int taMisc::read_till_end_quote_semi(istream& strm, bool peek) {
2682 int c = read_till_end_quote(strm, peek);
2683 if (c == EOF(-1)) return c;
2684 if (peek) strm.get(); // consume the "
2685 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && (c != ';'))
2686 c = strm.get();
2687 if (c == EOF(-1)) return c;
2688 if (!peek)
2689 strm.get(); // consume the ;
2690 return c;
2691}
2692
2693int taMisc::skip_past_err(istream& strm, bool peek) {
2694 int c;
2695 int depth = 0;
2696 if(taMisc::verbose_load >= taMisc::SOURCE) {
2697 int cur_pos = 0;
2698 ConsoleOutputChars("<<err_skp ->>", true);
2699 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && !(((c == '}') || (c == ';')) && (depth <= 0))) {
2700 ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true); cur_pos++;
2701 if(c == '{') depth++;
2702 if(c == '}') depth--;
2703 strm.get();
2704 }
2705 if(c != EOF(-1)) ConsoleOutputChars(StringtaString((char)c) + "<<- err_skp>>", true);
2706 }
2707 else {
2708 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && !(((c == '}') || (c == ';')) && (depth <= 0))) {
2709 if(c == '{') depth++;
2710 if(c == '}') depth--;
2711 strm.get();
2712 }
2713 }
2714 if(!peek) {
2715 strm.get();
2716 if((c != EOF(-1)) && (strm.peek() == ';')) strm.get(); // skip next semi
2717 }
2718 return c;
2719}
2720
2721int taMisc::skip_past_err_rb(istream& strm, bool peek) {
2722 int c;
2723 int depth = 0;
2724 if(taMisc::verbose_load >= taMisc::SOURCE) {
2725 ConsoleOutputChars("<<err_skp ->>", true);
2726 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && !((c == '}') && (depth <= 0))) {
2727 ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2728 if(c == '{') depth++;
2729 if(c == '}') depth--;
2730 strm.get();
2731 }
2732 if(c != EOF(-1)) ConsoleOutputChars(StringtaString((char)c) + "<<- err_skp>>", true);
2733 }
2734 else {
2735 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && !((c == '}') && (depth <= 0))) {
2736 if(c == '{') depth++;
2737 if(c == '}') depth--;
2738 strm.get();
2739 }
2740 }
2741 if(!peek) {
2742 strm.get();
2743 if((c != EOF(-1)) && (strm.peek() == ';')) strm.get(); // skip next semi
2744 }
2745 return c;
2746}
2747
2748
2749int taMisc::find_not_in_quotes(const StringtaString& str, char c, int start) {
2750 int len = str.length();
2751 bool in_str = false;
2752 if(start < 0) {
2753 for(int i=len+start; i>=0; i--) {
2754 char cv = str[i];
2755 if(cv == '\"') {
2756 in_str = !in_str;
2757 continue;
2758 }
2759 if(!in_str && cv == c) return i;
2760 }
2761 }
2762 else {
2763 for(int i=start; i<len; i++) {
2764 char cv = str[i];
2765 if(cv == '\"') {
2766 in_str = !in_str;
2767 continue;
2768 }
2769 if(!in_str && cv == c) return i;
2770 }
2771 }
2772 return -1;
2773}
2774
2775int taMisc::replace_strings(istream& istrm, ostream& ostrm, NameVar_PArray& repl_list) {
2776 int n_repl = 0;
2777 int c;
2778 StringtaString nwln;
2779 while((c = read_till_eol(istrm)) != EOF(-1)) {
2780 nwln = LexBuf;
2781 for(int i=0;i<repl_list.size;i++) {
2782 StringtaString repl = repl_list[i].name;
2783 if(repl.contains("/w")) { // special whitespace flag
2784 StringtaString pre = repl.before("/w");
2785 if(!nwln.contains(pre)) continue;
2786 StringtaString post = repl.after("/w");
2787 if(!nwln.contains(post)) continue;
2788 StringtaString nwpre = nwln.before(pre);
2789 StringtaString nwpost = nwln.after(post);
2790 nwln = nwpre + repl_list[i].value.toString() + nwpost;
2791 }
2792 else {
2793 n_repl += nwln.gsub(repl, repl_list[i].value.toString());
2794 }
2795 }
2796 ostrm << nwln << endl;
2797 }
2798 return n_repl;
2799}
2800
2801int taMisc::find_strings(istream& istrm, String_PArray& strs) {
2802 int c;
2803 StringtaString nwln;
2804 while((c = read_till_eol(istrm)) != EOF(-1)) {
2805 for(int i=0;i<strs.size;i++) {
2806 if(LexBuf.contains(strs[i])) return i;
2807 }
2808 }
2809 return -1; // none found
2810}
2811
2812////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2813// HTML-style tags
2814
2815taMisc::ReadTagStatus taMisc::read_tag(istream& strm, StringtaString& tag, StringtaString& val) {
2816 int c = skip_white(strm, true);
2817 if(c == EOF(-1)) return TAG_EOF;
2818 if(c != '<') return TAG_NONE;
2819 strm.get();
2820 c = strm.peek();
2821 if(c == EOF(-1)) return TAG_EOF;
2822 ReadTagStatus rval = TAG_GOT;
2823 if(c == '/') {
2824 strm.get();
2825 rval = TAG_END;
2826 }
2827 read_till_rangle(strm, false);
2828 if(LexBuf.contains(' ')) {
2829 tag = LexBuf.before(' ');
2830 val = LexBuf.after(' ');
2831 }
2832 else {
2833 tag = LexBuf;
2834 val = "";
2835 }
2836 c = strm.peek();
2837 if(c == '\r' || c == '\n') strm.get(); // absorb an immediate cr after tag, which is common
2838 if(c == '\r') {
2839 c = strm.peek();
2840 if(c == '\n') strm.get(); // absorb an immediate cr after tag, which is common
2841 }
2842 return rval;
2843}
2844
2845int taMisc::read_till_rangle(istream& strm, bool peek) {
2846 int c;
2847 LexBuf = "";
2848 int depth = 0;
2849 if(taMisc::verbose_load >= taMisc::SOURCE) {
2850 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && !((c == '>') && (depth <= 0))) {
2851 ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2852 LexBuf += (char)c;
2853 if(c == '<') depth++;
2854 if(c == '>') depth--;
2855 strm.get();
2856 }
2857 if(c != EOF(-1)) ConsoleOutputChars((char)c, true);
2858 }
2859 else {
2860 while (((c = strm.peek()) != EOF(-1)) && !((c == '>') && (depth <= 0))) {
2861 LexBuf += (char)c;
2862 if(c == '<') depth++;
2863 if(c == '>') depth--;
2864 strm.get();
2865 }
2866 }
2867 if(!peek)
2868 strm.get();
2869 return c;
2870}
2871
2872////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2873// File Parsing Stuff for Dump routines: Output
2874
2875ostream& taMisc::indent(ostream& strm, int indent, int tsp) {
2876 // don't do any fancy things for undo saving -- just wastes space!
2877 if(is_saving && ((save_format == PLAIN) || is_undo_saving)) return strm;
2878 int i;
2879 int itabs = (indent * tsp) / 8;
2880 int ispcs = (indent * tsp) % 8;
2881 for(i=0; i<itabs; i++)
2882 strm << "\t";
2883 for(i=0; i<ispcs; i++)
2884 strm << " ";
2885 return strm;
2886}
2887
2888ostream& taMisc::write_quoted_string(ostream& strm, const StringtaString& str, bool write_if_empty) {
2889 if (!write_if_empty && str.empty()) return strm;
2890
2891 strm << '\"';
2892 int l = str.length();
2893 for (int i = 0; i < l; ++i) {
2894 char c = str.elem(i);
2895 // we slash escape slashes and quotes
2896 //TODO: perhaps we should escape other control chars as well
2897 if ((c == '\"') || (c == '\\'))
2898 strm << '\\';
2899 //else
2900 strm << c;
2901 }
2902 strm << '\"';
2903 return strm;
2904}
2905
2906
2907
2908//////////////////////////
2909// IDataLinkProxy //
2910//////////////////////////
2911
2912TypeDef* IDataLinkProxy::GetDataTypeDef() const {
2913 taDataLink* link_ = (taDataLink*)link();
2914 return (link_) ? link_->GetDataTypeDef() : NULL__null;
2915}
2916
2917//////////////////////////
2918// IDataLinkClient //
2919//////////////////////////
2920
2921IDataLinkClient::~IDataLinkClient() {
2922 if (m_link) {
2923 //NOTE: since this is destructor, the 'this' we pass is our *own* virtual v-table
2924 // version, therefore, RemoveDataClient may NOT use any of our virtual or pure-virtual methods
2925 m_link->RemoveDataClient(this); //nulls our ref
2926 }
2927}
2928
2929bool IDataLinkClient::AddDataLink(taDataLink* dl) {
2930 if (m_link && (m_link != dl)) {
2931 taMisc::DebugInfo("IDataLinkClient::AddDataLink: a link has already been set!");
2932 }
2933 bool r = (0 == m_link);
2934 m_link = dl;
2935 return r;
2936}
2937
2938bool IDataLinkClient::RemoveDataLink(taDataLink* dl) {
2939 bool r = (0 != m_link);
2940 m_link = NULL__null;
2941 return r;
2942}
2943
2944//////////////////////////////////
2945// IMultiDataLinkClient //
2946//////////////////////////////////
2947
2948IMultiDataLinkClient::~IMultiDataLinkClient() {
2949 while (dls.size > 0) {
2950 taDataLink* dl = dls.Pop();
2951 dl->RemoveDataClient(this);
2952 }
2953}
2954
2955bool IMultiDataLinkClient::AddDataLink(taDataLink* dl) {
2956 return dls.AddUnique(dl);
2957}
2958
2959bool IMultiDataLinkClient::RemoveDataLink(taDataLink* dl) {
2960 return dls.RemoveEl(dl);
2961}
2962
2963//////////////////////////
2964// taDataLink //
2965//////////////////////////
2966
2967const KeyStringQString taDataLink::key_name("name");
2968
2969taDataLink::taDataLink(void* data_, taDataLink* &link_ref_)
2970{
2971 // save data items reference, and set us in it
2972 m_data = data_;
2973 m_link_ref = &link_ref_;
2974 link_ref_ = this;
2975 m_dbu_cnt = 0;
2976}
2977
2978taDataLink::~taDataLink() {
2979 *m_link_ref = NULL__null; //note: m_link_ref is always valid, because the constructor passed it by reference
2980 if (clients.size > 0) {
2981 taMisc::DebugInfo("taDataLink::~taDataLink: clients.size not zero!");
2982 }
2983}
2984
2985bool taDataLink::AddDataClient(IDataLinkClient* dlc) {
2986 if (!clients.AddUnique(dlc)) return false; // already added
2987 return dlc->AddDataLink(this);
2988}
2989
2990void taDataLink::DataDestroying() { //note: linklist will automatically remove us
2991 IDataLinkClient* dlc;
2992 while (clients.size > 0) {
2993 //NOTE: client could destroy, so we have to remove it now
2994 dlc = clients.Pop();
2995 dlc->RemoveDataLink(this);
2996 //NOTE: client can still refer to us, but must do so through the ref we pass it
2997 dlc->DataLinkDestroying(this);
2998 }
2999}
3000
3001void taDataLink::DoNotify(int dcr, void* op1_, void* op2_) {
3002#if !defined(NO_TA_BASE)
3003 // check for dispatch in a thread, which is Very Bad(TM)!!!
3004 if (!taTaskThread::inMainThread()) {
3005 taMisc::DebugInfo("A non-main thread has caused a taDataLink::DoNotify -- not allowed, notify will not be sent");
3006 return;
3007 }
3008#endif
3009 for (int i = 0; i < clients.size; ++i) {
3010 IDataLinkClient* dlc = clients.FastEl(i);
3011 if ((dcr == DCR_REBUILD_VIEWS) && !dlc->isDataView()) continue;
3012 if (dlc->ignoreDataChanged())
3013 dlc->IgnoredDataChanged(this, dcr, op1_, op2_);
3014 else
3015 dlc->DataDataChanged(this, dcr, op1_, op2_);
3016 }
3017}
3018
3019// set this to emit debug messages for the following code..
3020// #define DATA_DATA_DEBUG 1
3021
3022void taDataLink::DataDataChanged(int dcr, void* op1_, void* op2_) {
3023/*
3024 m_dbu_cnt = 0: idle state
3025 m_dbu_cnt < 0: in a DATA_UPDATE context
3026 m_dbu_cnt > 0: in a STRUCT_UPDATE context
3027
3028 If we only ever issue DATA BEGIN/ENDs, we remain in DATA state;
3029 If we ever issue a STRUCT BEGIN, we get forced into STRUCT state,
3030 and any subsequent DATA commands get interpreted as STRUCT.
3031
3032 We try to suppress unnecessary guys.
3033 If we start with STRUCT or DATA and do all the same (no different)
3034 then we only issue the first and last; but if DATA->STRUCT,
3035 then we also need to issue the STRUCT, however to maintain
3036 balance, we issue a semi-spurious DATA END, so we have equal
3037 numbers of + and -; NOTE: This situation is very unlikely to
3038 actually occur, since Struct and Data ops are typically mutually
3039 exclusive, and even then, the most likely is DATA ops nested inside
3040 a STRUCT update (not the other way around.)
3041
3042 we need to send out all further STRUCT ops, and the final DATA one
3043*/
3044 bool send_iu = false; // set true if we should send a synthetic ITEM_UPDATED
3045 bool suppress = false; // set it if we should supress forwarding
3046 bool dummy_end = false;
3047 //we translate the NoDirty guy, since it is only for the sender's use
3048 if (dcr == DCR_ITEM_UPDATED_ND) {
3049 dcr = DCR_ITEM_UPDATED;
3050 }
3051 if (dcr == DCR_STRUCT_UPDATE_BEGIN) { // forces us to be in struct state
3052 // only forward the first one (ex some clients do a reset step)
3053 // OR the first one where DATA->STRUCT
3054 suppress = (m_dbu_cnt > 0); // send if first, or we were in DATA state
3055 if (m_dbu_cnt < 0) { // switch state if in DATA state
3056 m_dbu_cnt = -m_dbu_cnt;
3057 dummy_end = true;
3058 }
3059 ++m_dbu_cnt;
3060#ifdef DATA_DATA_DEBUG
3061 taMisc::Info((StringtaString)(int)this, "stru beg:", StringtaString(m_dbu_cnt));
3062#endif
3063 }
3064 else if (dcr == DCR_DATA_UPDATE_BEGIN) {
3065 suppress = (m_dbu_cnt != 0);
3066 if (m_dbu_cnt > 0) ++m_dbu_cnt; // stay in STRUCT state if STRUCT state
3067 else --m_dbu_cnt;
3068#ifdef DATA_DATA_DEBUG
3069 taMisc::Info((StringtaString)(int)this, "data beg:", StringtaString(m_dbu_cnt));
3070#endif
3071 }
3072 else if ((dcr == DCR_STRUCT_UPDATE_END) || (dcr == DCR_DATA_UPDATE_END)) {
3073#ifdef DATA_DATA_DEBUG
3074 bool was_stru = false; // debug only
3075 if(dcr == DCR_STRUCT_UPDATE_END)
3076 was_stru = true;
3077#endif
3078 if (m_dbu_cnt < 0) {
3079 ++m_dbu_cnt;
3080 } else if (m_dbu_cnt > 0) {
3081 --m_dbu_cnt;
3082 dcr = DCR_STRUCT_UPDATE_END; // force to be struct end, in case we notify
3083 }
3084 // this situation might theoretically arise if some updating action
3085 // mid-update causes a link to an item to get created, which will then
3086 // not have been tracking all the BEGINs -- but it should be safe
3087 // to just keep letting them happen, doing gui updates, which should be harmless
3088#ifdef DEBUG // just make sure these are harmless, and don't scare users...
3089 else {
3090 taMisc::Warning("Datalink for object name:", GetName(),
3091 "unexpectedly received a DATA or STRUCT END (cnt was 0)");
3092 }
3093#endif
3094#ifdef DATA_DATA_DEBUG
3095 if(was_stru)
3096 taMisc::Info((StringtaString)(int)this, "stru end:", StringtaString(m_dbu_cnt));
3097 else
3098 taMisc::Info((StringtaString)(int)this, "data end:", StringtaString(m_dbu_cnt));
3099#endif
3100 // at the end, also send a IU
3101 if (m_dbu_cnt == 0) {
3102 if (dcr == DCR_DATA_UPDATE_END) { // just turn it into an IU
3103 //NOTE: clients who count (ex taDataView) must detect this implicit
3104 // DATA_UPDATE_END as occurring when:
3105 // State=DATA, Count=1
3106 dcr = DCR_ITEM_UPDATED;
3107#ifdef DATA_DATA_DEBUG
3108 taMisc::Info((StringtaString)(int)this, "cvt to iu:", StringtaString(m_dbu_cnt));
3109#endif
3110 }
3111 else {// otherwise, we send both
3112 send_iu = true;
3113 }
3114 } else suppress = true;
3115 }
3116 else if (dcr == DCR_ITEM_UPDATED) {
3117 // if we are already updating, then ignore IUs, since we'll send one eventually
3118 if (m_dbu_cnt != 0) suppress = true;
3119 }
3120 else if (dcr < DCR_UPDATE_VIEWS) {
3121 // if we are already updating, then ignore IUs, since we'll send one eventually
3122 if (m_dbu_cnt != 0) suppress = true;
3123 }
3124
3125 if (!suppress) {
3126#ifdef DATA_DATA_DEBUG
3127 taMisc::Info((StringtaString)(int)this, "sending:", StringtaString(dcr));
3128#endif
3129 DoNotify(dcr, op1_, op2_);
3130 }
3131 if (dummy_end)
3132 DoNotify(DCR_DATA_UPDATE_END, NULL__null, NULL__null);
3133 if (send_iu)
3134 DoNotify(DCR_ITEM_UPDATED, NULL__null, NULL__null);
3135}
3136
3137StringtaString taDataLink::GetDisplayName() const {
3138 MemberDef* md = GetDataMemberDef();
3139 if (md) return md->name;
3140 else return GetName();
3141}
3142
3143TypeDef* taDataLink::GetTypeDef() const {
3144#if !defined(TA_NO_GUI) && !defined(NO_TA_BASE)
3145 return &TA_taDataLink;
3146#else
3147 return NULL__null;
3148#endif
3149}
3150
3151bool taDataLink::RemoveDataClient(IDataLinkClient* dlc) {
3152 //WARNING: dlc calls this in its destructor, therefore 'dlc' is IDataLinkClient virtual
3153 // version, therefore, RemoveDataClient may NOT use any IDataLinkClient virtual methods
3154 // that are intended to be overloaded
3155 // exception: IMultiDataLinkClient calls from its own destructor, so its virtuals are ok
3156 dlc->RemoveDataLink(this);
3157 return clients.RemoveEl(dlc);
3158}
3159
3160void* taDataLinkItr::NextEl(taDataLink* dl, const TypeDef* typ) {
3161 void* rval = NULL__null;
3162 while (dl && (i < dl->clients.size)) {
3163 IDataLinkClient* dlc = dl->clients.FastEl(i);
3164 ++i;
3165 TypeDef* dlc_typ = dlc->GetTypeDef();
3166 if (dlc_typ) {
3167 if (dlc_typ->InheritsFrom(typ)) {
3168 rval = dlc->This();
3169 break;
3170 }
3171 }
3172 }
3173 return rval;
3174}
3175

3177//////////////////////////////////
3178// TypeSpace //
3179//////////////////////////////////
3180
3181TypeSpace::~TypeSpace() {
3182 Reset();
3183 if (data_link) {
3184 data_link->DataDestroying(); // link NULLs our pointer
3185 }
3186}
3187
3188StringtaString TypeSpace::El_GetName_(void* it) const { return ((TypeDef*)it)->name; }
3189TALPtr TypeSpace::El_GetOwnerList_(void* it) const { return ((TypeDef*)it)->owner; }
3190void* TypeSpace::El_SetOwner_(void* it_) {
3191 if (!it_) return it_;
3192 TypeDef* it = (TypeDef*)it_;
3193 it->owner = this;
3194 //if this type is being added to anything during a plugin init, then
3195 // it is a plugin class, and we stamp it as such
3196#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
3197 if (taMisc::in_plugin_init) {
3198 it->plugin = taMisc::plugin_loading;
3199 }
3200#endif
3201 return it_;
3202
3203}
3204void TypeSpace::El_SetIndex_(void* it, int i){ ((TypeDef*)it)->idx = i; }
3205
3206void* TypeSpace::El_Ref_(void* it) { taRefN::Ref((TypeDef*)it); return it; }
3207void* TypeSpace::El_unRef_(void* it) { taRefN::unRef((TypeDef*)it); return it; }
3208void TypeSpace::El_Done_(void* it) { taRefN::Done((TypeDef*)it); }
3209void* TypeSpace::El_MakeToken_(void* it) { return (void*)((TypeDef*)it)->MakeToken(); }
3210void* TypeSpace::El_Copy_(void* trg, void* src)
3211{ ((TypeDef*)trg)->Copy(*((TypeDef*)src)); return trg; }
3212
3213TypeDef* TypeSpace::FindTypeR(const StringtaString& fqname) const {
3214 if (fqname.contains("::")) {
3215 TypeDef* td = FindName(fqname.before("::"));
3216 if (!td) return NULL__null;
3217 return td->sub_types.FindTypeR(fqname.after("::"));
3218 } else {
3219 return FindName(fqname);
3220 }
3221}
3222
3223
3224bool TypeSpace::ReplaceLinkAll(TypeDef* ol, TypeDef* nw) {
3225 bool rval = false;
3226 int i;
3227 for(i=0; i<size; i++) {
3228 if(FastEl(i) == ol) {
3229 rval = true;
3230 ReplaceLinkIdx(i, nw);
3231 }
3232 }
3233 return rval;
3234}
3235
3236bool TypeSpace::ReplaceParents(const TypeSpace& ol, const TypeSpace& nw) {
3237 bool rval = false;
3238 int i;
3239 for(i=0; i<size; i++) {
3240 int j;
3241 for(j=0; j<ol.size; j++) {
3242 TypeDef* old_st = ol.FastEl(j);
3243 TypeDef* new_st = nw.FastEl(j); // assumes one-to-one correspondence
3244
3245 if(FastEl(i)->ReplaceParent(old_st, new_st))
3246 rval = true;
3247 }
3248 }
3249 return rval;
3250}
3251
3252StringtaString& TypeSpace::PrintAllTokens(StringtaString& strm) const {
3253 for(int i=0; i<size; i++) {
3254 TypeDef* td = FastEl(i);
3255 if(!td->tokens.keep)
3256 continue;
3257 strm << td->name << ": \t" << td->tokens.size << " (sub: " << td->tokens.sub_tokens << ")\n";
3258 }
3259 return strm;
3260}

3263// EnumSpace //
3264//////////////////////////////////

3266StringtaString EnumSpace::El_GetName_(void* it) const { return ((EnumDef*)it)->name; }
3267TALPtr EnumSpace::El_GetOwnerList_(void* it) const { return ((EnumDef*)it)->owner; }
3268void* EnumSpace::El_SetOwner_(void* it) { return ((EnumDef*)it)->owner = this; }
3269void EnumSpace::El_SetIndex_(void* it, int i){ ((EnumDef*)it)->idx = i; }
3270
3271void* EnumSpace::El_Ref_(void* it) { taRefN::Ref((EnumDef*)it); return it; }
3272void* EnumSpace::El_unRef_(void* it) { taRefN::unRef((EnumDef*)it); return it; }
3273void EnumSpace::El_Done_(void* it) { taRefN::Done((EnumDef*)it); }
3274void* EnumSpace::El_MakeToken_(void* it) { return (void*)((EnumDef*)it)->MakeToken(); }
3275void* EnumSpace::El_Copy_(void* trg, void* src)
3276{ ((EnumDef*)trg)->Copy(*((EnumDef*)src)); return trg; }
3277
3278EnumSpace::~EnumSpace() {
3279 Reset();
3280 if (data_link) {
3281 data_link->DataDestroying(); // link NULLs our pointer
3282 }
3283}
3284
3285// default enum no is last + 1
3286void EnumSpace::Add(EnumDef* it) {
3287 taPtrList<EnumDef>::Add(it);
3288 if((it->idx == 0) || (it->idx > size+1))
3289 it->enum_no = 0;
3290 else
3291 it->enum_no = FastEl(it->idx - 1)->enum_no + 1;
3292}
3293
3294EnumDef* EnumSpace::Add(const char* nm, const char* dsc, const char* op, int eno) {
3295 EnumDef* rval = new EnumDef(nm);
3296 Add(rval);
3297 rval->desc = dsc;
3298 taMisc::CharToStrArray(rval->opts, op);
3299 rval->enum_no = eno;
3300 return rval;
3301}
3302
3303EnumDef* EnumSpace::FindNo(int eno) const {
3304 int i;
3305 for(i=0; i < size; i++) {
3306 if(FastEl(i)->enum_no == eno)
3307 return FastEl(i);
3308 }
3309 return NULL__null;
3310}

3313//////////////////////////////////
3314// TokenSpace //
3315//////////////////////////////////
3316
3317StringtaString TokenSpace::tmp_el_name;
3318
3319void TokenSpace::Initialize() {
3320 owner = NULL__null;
3321 keep = false;
3322 sub_tokens = 0;
3323 data_link = NULL__null;
3324}
3325
3326TokenSpace::~TokenSpace() {
3327// Reset(); //note: TokenSpace never had a Reset, but maybe it should...
3328 if (data_link) {
3329 data_link->DataDestroying(); // link NULLs our pointer
3330 }
3331}
3332
3333StringtaString TokenSpace::El_GetName_(void* it) const {
3334#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
3335 if((owner == NULL__null) || !(owner->InheritsFrom(TA_taBase))) {
3336#else
3337 if(owner == NULL__null) {
3338#endif
3339 tmp_el_name = StringtaString((ta_intptr_t)it);
3340 return tmp_el_name;
3341 }
3342#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
3343 taBase* tmp = (taBase*)it;
3344 return tmp->GetName();
3345#else
3346 return _nilStringtaString();
3347#endif
3348}
3349
3350StringtaString& TokenSpace::Print(StringtaString& strm, int indent) const {
3351 if(owner == NULL__null) return strm;
3352
3353 taMisc::IndentString(strm, indent);
3354 strm << "Tokens of type: " << owner->name << " (" << size
3355 << "), sub-tokens: " << sub_tokens;
3356 if(keep)
3357 strm << "\n";
3358 else
3359 strm << " (not keeping tokens)\n";
3360
3361 return taPtrList<void>::Print(strm, indent);
3362}

3367//////////////////////////////////

3369StringtaString MemberDefBase_List::El_GetName_(void* it) const
3370 { return ((MemberDefBase*)it)->name; }
3371TALPtr MemberDefBase_List::El_GetOwnerList_(void* it) const
3372 { return ((MemberDefBase*)it)->owner; }
3373void* MemberDefBase_List::El_SetOwner_(void* it)
3374 { return ((MemberDefBase*)it)->owner = this; }
3375void MemberDefBase_List::El_SetIndex_(void* it, int i)
3376 { ((MemberDefBase*)it)->idx = i; }
3377
3378void* MemberDefBase_List::El_Ref_(void* it)
3379 { taRefN::Ref((MemberDefBase*)it); return it; }
3380void* MemberDefBase_List::El_unRef_(void* it)
3381 { taRefN::unRef((MemberDefBase*)it); return it; }
3382void MemberDefBase_List::El_Done_(void* it)
3383 { taRefN::Done((MemberDefBase*)it); }
3384
3385
3386void* MemberDefBase_List::El_MakeToken_(void* it) {
3387 switch (((MemberDefBase*)it)->typeInfoKind()) {
3388 case taMisc::TIK_MEMBER:
3389 return (void*)((MemberDef*)it)->MakeToken();
3390 case taMisc::TIK_PROPERTY:
3391 return (void*)((PropertyDef*)it)->MakeToken();
3392 default: return NULL__null; // shouldn't happen!
3393 }
3394 return NULL__null; // compiler food
3395}
3396
3397// note: this use the "pseudo-virtual" type guy
3398void* MemberDefBase_List::El_Copy_(void* trg, void* src)
3399 { ((MemberDefBase*)trg)->Copy(((MemberDefBase*)src));
3400 return trg;
3401}
3402
3403MemberDefBase_List::~MemberDefBase_List() {
3404 Reset();
3405 if (data_link) {
3406 data_link->DataDestroying(); // link NULLs our pointer
3407 }
3408}
3409
3410//////////////////////////////////
3411// MemberSpace: Find By Name //
3412//////////////////////////////////
3413
3414int MemberSpace::FindNameOrType(const char *nm) const { // lookup by name
3415 int rval = FindNameIdx(nm);
3416 if(rval >= 0)
3417 return rval;
3418
3419 // then type names
3420 return FindTypeName(nm);
3421}
3422
3423int MemberSpace::FindTypeName(const char* nm) const {
3424 for(int i=0; i<size; i++) {
3425 if(FastEl(i)->type->InheritsFrom(nm))
3426 return i;
3427 }
3428 return -1;
3429}
3430
3431MemberDef* MemberSpace::FindNameR(const char* nm) const {
3432 if (MemberDef *rval = FindName(nm)) {
3433 return rval;
3434 }
3435
3436 for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
3437 if (FastEl(i)->type->ptr == 0) {
3438 if (MemberDef *rval = FastEl(i)->type->members.FindNameR(nm)) {
3439 return rval;
3440 }
3441 }
3442 }
3443 return NULL__null;
3444}
3445
3446MemberDef* MemberSpace::FindNameAddr(const char* nm, void* base, void*& ptr) const {
3447 if (MemberDef *rval = FindName(nm)) {
3448 ptr = rval->GetOff(base);
3449 return rval;
3450 }
3451 ptr = NULL__null;
3452 return NULL__null;
3453}
3454
3455//////////////////////////////////
3456// MemberSpace: Find By Type //
3457//////////////////////////////////
3458
3459MemberDef* MemberSpace::FindType(TypeDef* it) const {
3460 for (int i = 0; i<size; i++) {
3461 if (FastEl(i)->type->InheritsFrom(it)) {
3462 return FastEl(i);
3463 }
3464 }
3465 return NULL__null;
3466}
3467
3468MemberDef* MemberSpace::FindTypeR(TypeDef* it) const {
3469 if (MemberDef *rval = FindType(it)) {
3470 return rval;
3471 }
3472
3473 for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
3474 if (FastEl(i)->type->ptr == 0) {
3475 if (MemberDef *rval = FastEl(i)->type->members.FindTypeR(it)) {
3476 return rval;
3477 }
3478 }
3479 }
3480 return NULL__null;
3481}
3482
3483MemberDef* MemberSpace::FindTypeAddr(TypeDef* it, void* base, void*& ptr) const {
3484 if (MemberDef *rval = FindType(it)) {
3485 ptr = rval->GetOff(base);
3486 return rval;
3487 }
3488 ptr = NULL__null;
3489 return NULL__null;
3490}
3491
3492//////////////////////////////////
3493// MemberSpace: other Find //
3494//////////////////////////////////
3495
3496int MemberSpace::FindDerives(TypeDef* it) const {
3497 int i;
3498 for(i=0; i<size; i++) {
3499 if(FastEl(i)->type->DerivesFrom(it))
3500 return i;
3501 }
3502 return -1;
3503}
3504
3505MemberDef* MemberSpace::FindTypeDerives(TypeDef* it) const {
3506 int idx = FindDerives(it);
3507 if(idx >= 0) return FastEl(idx);
3508 return NULL__null;
3509}
3510
3511MemberDef* MemberSpace::FindAddr(void* base, void* mbr, int& idx) const {
3512 int i;
3513 for(i=0; i<size; i++) {
3514 if(mbr == FastEl(i)->GetOff(base)) {
3515 idx = i;
3516 return FastEl(i);
3517 }
3518 }
3519 idx = -1;
3520 return NULL__null;
3521}
3522
3523int MemberSpace::FindPtr(void* base, void* mbr) const {
3524 int i;
3525 for(i=0; i<size; i++) {
3526 MemberDef* md = FastEl(i);
3527 // check conventional pointers of any type
3528 if((md->type->ptr == 1) && (mbr == *((void **)md->GetOff(base))))
3529 return i;
3530 // Variants: just check for equivalence to contained pointer,
3531 // if doesn't contain a ptr, test will return null
3532 if (md->type->InheritsFrom(TA_Variant)) {
3533 Variant& var = *((Variant*)md->GetOff(base));
3534 if (mbr == var.toPtr())
3535 return i;
3536 }
3537
3538 }
3539 return -1;
3540}
3541
3542MemberDef* MemberSpace::FindAddrPtr(void* base, void* mbr, int& idx) const {
3543 idx = FindPtr(base, mbr);
3544 if(idx >= 0) return FastEl(idx);
3545 return NULL__null;
3546}
3547
3548
3549
3550//////////////////////////////////
3551// PropertySpace //
3552//////////////////////////////////
3553
3554void PropertyDef::setType(TypeDef* typ) {
3555 if (!typ) {
3556 taMisc::Error("PropertyDef::", name, ": attempt to set NULL type!");
3557 return;
3558 }
3559 if (type) {
3560 if (type != typ)
3561 taMisc::Warning("PropertyDef::", name, ": changed type from ",
3562 type->name, " to ", typ->name);
3563 }
3564 type = typ;
3565}
3566
3567#ifdef NO_TA_BASE
3568PropertyDef* PropertySpace::AssertProperty_impl(const char* nm, bool& is_new,
3569 bool get_nset, MemberDef* mbr, MethodDef* mth)
3570{
3571 MemberDefBase* md = FindName(nm);
3572 PropertyDef* pd = dynamic_cast<PropertyDef*>(md);
3573 //note: following actually won't happen, because maketa doesn't add members
3574 if (md && !pd) {
3575 taMisc::Warning("PropertySpace::AssertProperty: attempt to find PropertyDef '",
3576 nm, "' but MemberDef already exists\n");
3577 return NULL__null;
3578 }
3579 TypeItem* ti = NULL__null;
3580 if (!pd) {
3581 pd = new PropertyDef(nm);
3582 Add(pd);
3583 is_new = true;
3584 } else
3585 is_new = false;
3586 if (mbr) {
3587 ti = mbr;
3588 if (get_nset) {
3589 pd->setType(mbr->type);
3590 taRefN::SetRefDone(*((taRefN**)&pd->get_mbr), mbr);
3591 } else {
3592 pd->setType(mbr->type);
3593 taRefN::SetRefDone(*((taRefN**)&pd->set_mbr), mbr);
3594 }
3595 }
3596 if (mth) {
3597 ti = mth;
3598 if (get_nset) {
3599 TypeDef* td = mth->type;
3600 if (td)
3601 td = td->GetNonConstType();
3602 pd->setType(td);
3603 taRefN::SetRefDone(*((taRefN**)&pd->get_mth), mth);
3604 } else {
3605 TypeDef* td = mth->arg_types.SafeEl(0);
3606 if (td)
3607 td = td->GetNonConstNonRefType();
3608 pd->setType(td);
3609 taRefN::SetRefDone(*((taRefN**)&pd->set_mth), mth);
3610 }
3611 }
3612 // new getters control all the opts, desc, etc.
3613 if (is_new && get_nset) {
3614 pd->desc = ti->desc;
3615 pd->opts = ti->opts;
3616 pd->lists = ti->lists;
3617 }
3618 return pd;
3619}
3620#endif
3621
3622//////////////////////////////////
3623// PropertySpace: Find By Name //
3624//////////////////////////////////
3625
3626int PropertySpace::FindNameOrType(const char *nm) const { // lookup by name
3627 int rval = 0; //init just to keep msvc happy
3628 // first check names
3629 if(FindName(nm),rval)
3630 return rval;
3631
3632 // then type names
3633 return FindTypeName(nm);
3634}
3635
3636int PropertySpace::FindTypeName(const char* nm) const {
3637 for(int i=0; i<size; i++) {
3638 if(FastEl(i)->type->InheritsFrom(nm))
3639 return i;
3640 }
3641 return -1;
3642}
3643
3644MemberDefBase* PropertySpace::FindNameR(const char* nm) const {
3645 if (MemberDefBase *rval = FindName(nm)) {
3646 return rval;
3647 }
3648
3649 for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
3650 if (FastEl(i)->type->ptr == 0) {
3651 if (MemberDefBase *rval = FastEl(i)->type->properties.FindNameR(nm)) {
3652 return rval;
3653 }
3654 }
3655 }
3656 return NULL__null;
3657}
3658
3659
3660//////////////////////////////////
3661// MethodSpace //
3662//////////////////////////////////
3663
3664StringtaString MethodSpace::El_GetName_(void* it) const { return ((MethodDef*)it)->name; }
3665TALPtr MethodSpace::El_GetOwnerList_(void* it) const { return ((MethodDef*)it)->owner; }
3666void* MethodSpace::El_SetOwner_(void* it) { return ((MethodDef*)it)->owner = this; }
3667void MethodSpace::El_SetIndex_(void* it, int i){ ((MethodDef*)it)->idx = i; }
3668
3669void* MethodSpace::El_Ref_(void* it) { taRefN::Ref((MethodDef*)it); return it; }
3670void* MethodSpace::El_unRef_(void* it) { taRefN::unRef((MethodDef*)it); return it; }
3671void MethodSpace::El_Done_(void* it) { taRefN::Done((MethodDef*)it); }
3672void* MethodSpace::El_MakeToken_(void* it) { return (void*)((MethodDef*)it)->MakeToken(); }
3673void* MethodSpace::El_Copy_(void* trg, void* src)
3674{ ((MethodDef*)trg)->Copy(*((MethodDef*)src)); return trg; }
3675
3676MethodSpace::~MethodSpace() {
3677 Reset();
3678 if (data_link) {
3679 data_link->DataDestroying(); // link NULLs our pointer
3680 }
3681}
3682
3683bool MethodSpace::AddUniqNameNew(MethodDef *it) {
3684 bool result = false;
3685 {
3686/*NOTE:
3687 At present, typea is only able to manage a single method per name.
3688 We only retain the last one scanned (so we always replace previously
3689 encountered ones with new ones.)
3690 It is HIGHLY recommended to write source with unique names, and use
3691 variants on names or default parameters to achieve overloading.
3692*/
3693 MethodDef* rval = NULL__null;
3694 bool replace = false; // we set true if we should replace the one we find
3695 int idx;
3696 // we first see if it is an override of a virtual base...
3697 if (!it->is_static) // of course statics can't be virtual
3698 rval = FindVirtualBase(it, idx); //note: only finds virtuals, not non-virtuals
3699 if (rval) {
3700 if (it == rval) {result = false; goto end;} // could be the same one..
3701 it->is_virtual = true; // may not have been set for implicit override
3702 it->is_override = true; // this is our job to set
3703 // the overload count will be same for an override
3704 it->fun_overld = rval->fun_overld;
3705 // because we are the same method as the one encounters, we inherit its opts
3706 it->lists.DupeUnique(rval->lists);
3707// automatically inherit regular options
3708 it->opts.DupeUnique(rval->opts);
3709// but not comments or inherited options (which would be redundant)
3710// it->opts.DupeUnique(rval->inh_opts);
3711// it->inh_opts.DupeUnique(rval->inh_opts);
3712 if ((it->desc.empty()) || (it->desc == " "))
3713 it->desc = rval->desc; // get the comment if we don't actually have one now..
3714 replace = true; // always replace
3715 } else {
3716 // ok, we are not a virtual override, but check if we are an overload or lexical hide
3717 // since we aren't an override, we are a new entity, so will replace
3718 idx = FindNameIdx(it->name);
3719 if(idx >= 0) rval = FastEl(idx);
3720 if (rval) {
3721 replace = true;
3722 if (it == rval) {result = false; goto end;}// could be the same one..
3723 it->fun_overld = rval->fun_overld;
3724 // if the args are identical, then we are lexically hiding the previous
3725 // one -- we will therefore replace it, but of course not set "override"
3726 if (it->CompareArgs(rval)) {
3727 it->is_lexhide = true; // note: this is not often done, and could be an error
3728 } else {
3729 it->fun_overld++; // normal overload
3730 }
3731/*NOTE: in v3.2, this would seem to have applied mostly for virtual overrides
3732 // never overloaded, not adding any new options
3733 if (!it->is_static && (it->fun_overld == 0) && (it->opts.size == 0) && (it->lists.size == 0))
3734 return false; */
3735 }
3736 }
3737 if (replace) {
3738 ReplaceIdx(idx, it); // new one replaces old if overloaded or overridden
3739 result = false;
3740 goto end;
3741 }
3742 inherited::Add(it);
3743 result = true; // yes, its unique
3744 } // block, for jump
3745end:
3746 return result;
3747}
3748
3749MethodDef* MethodSpace::FindAddr(ta_void_fun funa, int& idx) const {
3750 int i;
3751 idx = 0;
3752 for(i=0; i<size; i++) {
3753 if(FastEl(i)->addr == funa) {
3754 idx = i;
3755 return FastEl(i);
3756 }
3757 }
3758 return NULL__null;
3759}
3760
3761
3762// lidx is "index" in space for items on same list
3763MethodDef* MethodSpace::FindOnListAddr(ta_void_fun funa, const String_PArray& lst, int& lidx) const {
3764 int i;
3765 lidx = 0;
3766 for(i=0; i<size; i++) {
3767 if(FastEl(i)->CheckList(lst)) {
3768 if(FastEl(i)->addr == funa)
3769 return FastEl(i);
3770 lidx++;
3771 }
3772 }
3773 return NULL__null;
3774}
3775
3776MethodDef* MethodSpace::FindOnListIdx(int lidx, const String_PArray& lst) const {
3777 int i, chk = 0;
3778 for(i=0; i<size; i++) {
3779 if(FastEl(i)->CheckList(lst)) {
3780 if(chk == lidx)
3781 return FastEl(i);
3782 chk++;
3783 }
3784 }
3785 return NULL__null;
3786}
3787
3788MethodDef* MethodSpace::FindVirtualBase(MethodDef* it, int& idx) {
3789 idx = -1;
3790 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
3791 MethodDef* rval = FastEl(i);
3792 if (!rval->is_virtual) continue;
3793 if (rval->name != it->name) continue;
3794 if(!rval->CompareArgs(it)) continue;
3795 idx = i;
3796 return rval;
3797 }
3798 return NULL__null;
3799}
3800
3801
3802//////////////////////////
3803// TypeItem //
3804//////////////////////////
3805const StringtaString TypeItem::opt_show("SHOW");
3806const StringtaString TypeItem::opt_no_show("NO_SHOW");
3807const StringtaString TypeItem::opt_hidden("HIDDEN");
3808const StringtaString TypeItem::opt_read_only("READ_ONLY");
3809const StringtaString TypeItem::opt_expert("EXPERT");
3810const StringtaString TypeItem::opt_edit_show("EDIT_SHOW");
3811const StringtaString TypeItem::opt_edit_no_show("EDIT_NO_SHOW");
3812const StringtaString TypeItem::opt_edit_hidden("EDIT_HIDDEN");
3813const StringtaString TypeItem::opt_edit_read_only("EDIT_READ_ONLY");
3814const StringtaString TypeItem::opt_edit_detail("EDIT_DETAIL");
3815const StringtaString TypeItem::opt_edit_expert("EDIT_EXPERT");
3816const StringtaString TypeItem::opt_APPLY_IMMED("APPLY_IMMED");
3817const StringtaString TypeItem::opt_NO_APPLY_IMMED("NO_APPLY_IMMED");
3818const StringtaString TypeItem::opt_inline("INLINE");
3819const StringtaString TypeItem::opt_edit_inline("EDIT_INLINE");
3820const StringtaString TypeItem::opt_EDIT_DIALOG("EDIT_DIALOG");
3821
3822const StringtaString TypeItem::opt_bits("BITS");
3823const StringtaString TypeItem::opt_instance("INSTANCE");
3824
3825TypeItem::TypeItem()
3826:inherited()
3827{
3828 init();
3829}
3830
3831TypeItem::TypeItem(const TypeItem& cp) {
3832 init();
3833 Copy_(cp);
3834}
3835
3836void TypeItem::init()
3837{
3838 idx = 0;
3839 data_link = NULL__null;
3840}
3841
3842TypeItem::~TypeItem() {
3843 if (data_link != NULL__null) {
3844 data_link->DataDestroying(); // link NULLs our pointer
3845 }
3846}
3847
3848void TypeItem::Copy(const TypeItem& cp) {
3849 Copy_(cp);
3850}
3851
3852void TypeItem::Copy_(const TypeItem& cp) {
3853 name = cp.name;
3854 desc = cp.desc;
3855 opts = cp.opts;
3856 lists = cp.lists;
3857}
3858
3859StringtaString TypeItem::OptionAfter(const StringtaString& op) const {
3860 StringtaString tmp_label;
3861 int opt = opts.FindStartsWith(op, -1);
3862 if (opt >= 0) { // search bckwrds for overrides..
3863 tmp_label = opts.FastEl(opt).after(op);
3864 }
3865 return tmp_label;
3866}
3867
3868bool TypeItem::HasOptionAfter(const StringtaString& prefix, const StringtaString& op) const {
3869 int idx = -1;
3870 do {
3871 idx = opts.FindStartsWith(prefix, idx + 1);
3872 if (idx >= 0) {
3873 if (opts.FastEl(idx).after(prefix) == op) {
3874 return true;
3875 }
3876 }
3877 }
3878 while (idx >= 0);
3879 return false;
3880}
3881
3882bool TypeItem::NextOptionAfter(const StringtaString& pre, int& itr, StringtaString& res) const
3883{
3884 if (itr < 0) itr = 0; // sanity
3885 while (itr < opts.size) {
3886 StringtaString opt = opts.FastEl(itr);
3887 ++itr;
3888 if (opt.matches(pre)) {
3889 res = opt.after(pre);
3890 return true;
3891 }
3892 }
3893 return false;
3894}
3895
3896
3897StringtaString TypeItem::GetLabel() const {
3898 StringtaString rval = OptionAfter("LABEL_");
3899 if((rval.empty()) && !HasOption("LABEL_")) { // not intentionally blank
3900 rval = name;
3901 taMisc::SpaceLabel(rval);
3902 } else // do translate spaces..
3903 rval.gsub('_', ' ');
3904 return rval;
3905}
3906
3907StringtaString TypeItem::GetOptsHTML() const {
3908 if(opts.size == 0) return _nilStringtaString();
3909 STRING_BUF(rval, 32)taString rval(0, 32, '\0'); // extends if needed
3910 rval.cat("Options: ");
3911 for(int i=0;i<opts.size;i++) {
3912 if(i > 0) rval.cat(", ");
3913 rval.cat(trim(opts[i]).xml_esc());
3914 }
3915 return rval;
3916}
3917
3918bool TypeItem::GetCondOpt(const StringtaString condkey, const TypeDef* base_td, const void* base,
3919 bool& is_on, bool& val_is_eq) const {
3920 // format: [CONDEDIT|CONDSHOW|GHOST]_[ON|OFF]_member[:value{,value}[&&,||member[:value{,value}...]] -- must all be && or || for logic
3921 StringtaString optedit = OptionAfter(condkey + "_");
3922 if (optedit.empty()) return false;
3923
3924 StringtaString onoff = optedit.before('_');
3925 is_on = (onoff == "ON"); //NOTE: should probably verify if OFF, otherwise it is an error
3926 optedit = optedit.after('_');
3927
3928 val_is_eq = false;
3929 int curlogic = 0; // 0 = nothing, 1 = AND, 2 = OR,
3930
3931 while(true) { // iterate on logical operations
3932 StringtaString nextedit;
3933 int nextlogic = 0; // 0 = nothing, 1 = AND, 2 = OR,
3934 int andloc = optedit.index("&&");
3935 int orloc = optedit.index("||");
3936 if(andloc > 0 && orloc > 0) {
3937 if(andloc < orloc) {
3938 nextlogic = 1;
3939 nextedit = optedit.after(andloc+1);
3940 optedit = optedit.before(andloc);
3941 }
3942 else {
3943 nextlogic = 2;
3944 nextedit = optedit.after(orloc+1);
3945 optedit = optedit.before(orloc);
3946 }
3947 }
3948 else if(andloc > 0) {
3949 nextlogic = 1;
3950 nextedit = optedit.after(andloc+1);
3951 optedit = optedit.before(andloc);
3952 }
3953 else if(orloc > 0) {
3954 nextlogic = 2;
3955 nextedit = optedit.after(orloc+1);
3956 optedit = optedit.before(orloc);
3957 }
3958
3959 StringtaString val = optedit.after(':');
3960
3961 // find the member name -- depends on mode, see below
3962 StringtaString mbr;
3963 if (val.empty())
3964 mbr = optedit; // entire thing is the member, implied boolean
3965 else
3966 mbr = optedit.before(':');
3967
3968 void* mbr_base = NULL__null; // base for conditionalizing member itself
3969 ta_memb_ptr net_mbr_off = 0; int net_base_off = 0;
3970 TypeDef* eff_td = (TypeDef*)base_td;
3971 MemberDef* md = TypeDef::FindMemberPathStatic(eff_td, net_base_off, net_mbr_off,
3972 mbr, false); // no warn..
3973 if (md) {
3974 mbr_base = MemberDef::GetOff_static(base, net_base_off, net_mbr_off);
3975 }
3976
3977 if (!md || !mbr_base) {
3978 // this can happen in valid cases (selectedit), and the msg is annoying
3979 // taMisc::Warning("taiType::CheckProcessCondMembMeth: conditionalizing member", mbr, "not found!");
3980 return false;
3981 }
3982
3983 bool tmp_val_is_eq = false;
3984 if (val.empty()) {
3985 // implied boolean member mode
3986 Variant mbr_val(md->type->GetValVar(mbr_base, md));
3987 tmp_val_is_eq = mbr_val.toBool();
3988 }
3989 else {
3990 // explicit value mode
3991 StringtaString mbr_val = md->type->GetValStr(mbr_base, NULL__null, md, TypeDef::SC_DEFAULT, true); // inline
3992 while (true) {
3993 StringtaString nxtval;
3994 if (val.contains(',')) {
3995 nxtval = val.after(',');
3996 val = val.before(',');
3997 }
3998 if(md->type->InheritsFormal(TA_enum) && mbr_val.contains('|')) { // bits!
3999 if(mbr_val.contains(val)) {
4000 StringtaString aft = mbr_val.after(val);
4001 StringtaString bef = mbr_val.before(val);
4002 if((aft.empty() || aft.firstchar() == '|') && (bef.empty() || bef.lastchar() == '|')) {
4003 // make sure it is not just a subset of something else..
4004 tmp_val_is_eq = true;
4005 break;
4006 }
4007 }
4008 }
4009 else {
4010 if (val == mbr_val) {
4011 tmp_val_is_eq = true;
4012 break;
4013 }
4014 }
4015 if (!nxtval.empty())
4016 val = nxtval;
4017 else
4018 break;
4019 } // value while
4020 } // if
4021
4022 if(curlogic == 0)
4023 val_is_eq = tmp_val_is_eq;
4024 else if(curlogic == 1)
4025 val_is_eq = val_is_eq && tmp_val_is_eq;
4026 else if(curlogic == 2)
4027 val_is_eq = val_is_eq || tmp_val_is_eq;
4028
4029 if(nextlogic > 0 && nextedit.nonempty()) {
4030 optedit = nextedit;
4031 curlogic = nextlogic;
4032 }
4033 else {
4034 break; // done!
4035 }
4036 } // outer logic while
4037 return true;
4038}
4039
4040bool TypeItem::GetCondOptTest(const StringtaString condkey, const TypeDef* base_td, const void* base) const {
4041 bool is_on = false; // defaults here make it return true if no opt spec'd at all
4042 bool val_is_eq = false;
4043 bool rval = GetCondOpt(condkey, base_td, base, is_on, val_is_eq);
4044 return ((is_on && val_is_eq) || (!is_on && !val_is_eq));
4045}
4046
4047
4048//////////////////////////
4049// EnumDef //
4050//////////////////////////
4051
4052
4053EnumDef::EnumDef()
4054:inherited()
4055{
4056 Initialize();
4057}
4058
4059EnumDef::EnumDef(const char* nm)
4060:inherited()
4061{
4062 Initialize();
4063 name = nm;
4064}
4065
4066EnumDef::EnumDef(const char* nm, const char* dsc, int eno, const char* op, const char* lis)
4067:inherited()
4068{
4069 name = nm;
4070 desc = dsc;
4071 enum_no = eno;
4072 taMisc::CharToStrArray(opts, op);
4073 taMisc::CharToStrArray(lists,lis);
4074}
4075
4076EnumDef::EnumDef(const EnumDef& cp)
4077:inherited(cp)
4078{
4079 Initialize();
4080 Copy_(cp);
4081}
4082
4083void EnumDef::Initialize() {
4084 owner = NULL__null;
4085 enum_no = 0;
4086}
4087
4088void EnumDef::Copy(const EnumDef& cp) {
4089 inherited::Copy(cp);
4090 Copy_(cp);
4091}
4092
4093void EnumDef::Copy_(const EnumDef& cp) {
4094 enum_no = cp.enum_no;
4095}
4096
4097bool EnumDef::CheckList(const String_PArray& lst) const {
4098 int i;
4099 for(i=0; i<lists.size; i++) {
4100 if(lst.FindEl(lists.FastEl(i)) >= 0)
4101 return true;
4102 }
4103 return false;
4104}
4105
4106
4107//////////////////////////////////
4108// MemberDefBase //
4109//////////////////////////////////
4110
4111void MemberDefBase::Initialize() {
4112 owner = NULL__null;
4113 type = NULL__null;
4114 is_static = false;
4115#ifdef TA_GUI1
4116 im = NULL__null;
4117#endif
4118 show_any = 0; // bits for show any -- 0 indicates not determined yet, 0x80 is flag
4119 show_edit = 0;
4120 show_tree = 0;
4121}
4122
4123MemberDefBase::MemberDefBase()
4124:inherited()
4125{
4126 Initialize();
4127}
4128
4129MemberDefBase::MemberDefBase(const char* nm)
4130:inherited()
4131{
4132 Initialize();
4133 name = nm;
4134}
4135
4136MemberDefBase::MemberDefBase(TypeDef* ty, const char* nm, const char* dsc,
4137 const char* op, const char* lis, bool is_stat)
4138:inherited()
4139{
4140 Initialize();
4141 type = ty; name = nm; desc = dsc;
4142 taMisc::CharToStrArray(opts,op);
4143 taMisc::CharToStrArray(lists,lis);
4144 is_static = is_stat;
4145}
4146
4147MemberDefBase::MemberDefBase(const MemberDefBase& cp)
4148:inherited(cp)
4149{
4150 Initialize();
4151 Copy_(cp);
4152}
4153
4154void MemberDefBase::Copy(const MemberDefBase& cp) {
4155 inherited::Copy(cp);
4156 Copy_(cp);
4157}
4158
4159void MemberDefBase::Copy(const MemberDefBase* cp) {
4160 if (typeInfoKind() == cp->typeInfoKind())
4161 switch (typeInfoKind()) {
4162 case taMisc::TIK_MEMBER:
4163 ((MemberDef*)this)->Copy(*(const MemberDef*)cp);
4164 return;
4165 case taMisc::TIK_PROPERTY:
4166 ((PropertyDef*)this)->Copy(*(const PropertyDef*)cp);
4167 return;
4168 default: break; // compiler food
4169 }
4170 Copy(*cp); // should never happen!
4171}
4172
4173void MemberDefBase::Copy_(const MemberDefBase& cp) {
4174 type = cp.type;
4175 inh_opts = cp.inh_opts;
4176 is_static = cp.is_static;
4177// don't copy because delete is not ref counted
4178// im = cp.im;
4179// always invalidate show bits, so they get redone in our new context
4180 show_any = 0; // bits for show any -- 0 indicates not determined yet, 0x80 is flag
4181 show_edit = 0;
4182 show_tree = 0;
4183}
4184
4185MemberDefBase::~MemberDefBase() {
4186#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
4187# ifndef NO_TA_GUI
4188 taRefN::SafeUnRefDone(im);
4189 im = NULL__null;
4190# endif
4191#endif
4192}
4193
4194bool MemberDefBase::CheckList(const String_PArray& lst) const {
4195 int i;
4196 for(i=0; i<lists.size; i++) {
4197 if(lst.FindEl(lists.FastEl(i)) >= 0)
4198 return true;
4199 }
4200 return false;
4201}
4202
4203bool MemberDefBase::ShowMember(
4204 int show_forbidden,
4205 TypeItem::ShowContext show_context,
4206 int show_allowed) const
4207{
4208 //note: require exact match to special flag, so boolean operations don't match it
4209 if (show_forbidden == taMisc::USE_SHOW_GUI_DEF)
4210 show_forbidden = taMisc::show_gui;
4211
4212 // check if cache has been done yet
4213 if (show_any == 0) ShowMember_CalcCache();
4214 byte show_eff = 0;
4215 // default viewability for edit is "any OR edit"
4216 // default viewability for tree is "tree", ie, any not good enough
4217 switch (show_context) {
4218 case SC_ANY: show_eff = show_any; break;
4219 case SC_EDIT: show_eff = show_edit; break;
4220 case SC_TREE: show_eff = show_tree; break;
4221 //note: should be no default, let compiler complain if any added
4222 }
4223 // our show_eff is the positives (what it is) so if there is nothing there, then
4224 // we clearly can't show
4225 // if there is something (a positive) then bit-AND with the
4226 // show, which is negatives (what not to show), and if anything remains, don't show!
4227// show_eff &= (byte)taMisc::SHOW_CHECK_MASK;
4228// return (show_eff) && !(show_eff & (byte)show);
4229 return 0 != (show_eff & (byte)show_allowed & ~(byte)show_forbidden);
4230}
4231
4232void MemberDefBase::ShowMember_CalcCache() const {
4233#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
4234 // default children are never shown
4235 TypeDef* par_typ = GetOwnerType();
4236 if (par_typ && par_typ->DerivesFrom(&TA_taOBase) &&
4237 !par_typ->DerivesFrom(&TA_taList_impl))
4238 {
4239 StringtaString mbr = par_typ->OptionAfter("DEF_CHILD_");
4240 if (mbr.nonempty() && (mbr == name)) {
4241 show_tree = 0x80; // set the "done" flag
4242 show_any = 0x80;
4243 show_edit = 0x80;
4244 return;
4245 }
4246 }
4247#endif
4248
4249 // note that "normal" is a special case, which depends both on context and
4250 // on whether other bits are set, so we calc those individually
4251 show_any = taMisc::IS_NORMAL; // the default for any
4252 ShowMember_CalcCache_impl(show_any, _nilStringtaString());
4253
4254 show_edit = show_any; // start with the "any" settings
4255 ShowMember_CalcCache_impl(show_edit, "_EDIT");
4256
4257#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
4258 show_tree = show_any;
4259 // for trees, we only browse lists/groups by default
4260 if (!type->DerivesFrom(&TA_taList_impl))
4261 show_tree &= ~(byte)taMisc::NO_NORMAL;
4262#endif
4263 ShowMember_CalcCache_impl(show_tree, "_TREE");
4264 //NOTE: lists/groups, we only show by default in lists/groups, embedded lists/groups
4265}
4266
4267void MemberDefBase::ShowMember_CalcCache_impl(byte& show, const StringtaString& suff) const {
4268 show |= 0x80; // set the "done" flag
4269
4270 //note: keep in mind that these show bits are the opposite of the show flags,
4271 // i.e show flags are all negative, whereas these are all positive (bit = is that type)
4272
4273 //note: member flags should generally trump type flags, so you can SHOW a NO_SHOW type
4274 //note: NO_SHOW is special, since it negates, so we check for base NO_SHOW everywhere
4275 bool typ_show = type->HasOption("MEMB_SHOW" + suff);
4276 bool typ_no_show = type->HasOption("MEMB_NO_SHOW") || type->HasOption("MEMB_NO_SHOW" + suff);
4277 bool mbr_show = HasOption("SHOW" + suff);
4278 bool mbr_no_show = HasOption("NO_SHOW") || HasOption("NO_SHOW" + suff);
4279
4280 // the following are all cumulative, not mutually exclusive
4281 if (HasOption("HIDDEN" + suff) || type->HasOption("MEMB_HIDDEN" + suff))
4282 show |= (byte)taMisc::IS_HIDDEN;
4283 // RO are HIDDEN unless explicitly marked SHOW
4284 // note: no type-level, makes no sense
4285 if ((HasOption("READ_ONLY") || HasOption("GUI_READ_ONLY")) && !HasOption("SHOW"))
4286 show |= (byte)taMisc::IS_HIDDEN;
4287 if (HasOption("EXPERT" + suff) || type->HasOption("MEMB_EXPERT" + suff))
4288 show |= (byte)taMisc::IS_EXPERT;
4289
4290 // if NO_SHOW and no SHOW or explicit other, then never shows
4291 if (mbr_no_show || (typ_no_show && (!mbr_show || (show & (byte)taMisc::NORM_MEMBS)))) {
4292 show &= (byte)(0x80 | ~taMisc::SHOW_CHECK_MASK);
4293 return;
4294 }
4295
4296 // if any of the special guys are set, we unset NORMAL (which may
4297 // or may not have been already set by default)
4298 if (show & (byte)taMisc::NORM_MEMBS) // in "any" context, default is "normal"
4299 show &= ~(byte)taMisc::IS_NORMAL;
4300 else // no non-NORMAL set
4301 // SHOW is like an explicit NORMAL if nothing else applies
4302 if (mbr_show || typ_show)
4303 show |= (byte)taMisc::IS_NORMAL;
4304}
4305
4306
4307
4308//////////////////////////////////
4309// MemberDef //
4310//////////////////////////////////
4311
4312void MemberDef::GetMembDesc(MemberDef* md, StringtaString& dsc_str, StringtaString indent) {
4313 StringtaString desc = md->desc;
4314 StringtaString defval = md->OptionAfter("DEF_");
4315 if(!defval.empty())
4316 desc = StringtaString("[Default: ") + defval + "] " + desc;
4317 else
4318 desc = desc;
4319 if(!indent.empty())
4320 desc = indent + md->GetLabel() + StringtaString(": ") + desc;
4321 if (!dsc_str.empty())
4322 dsc_str += "<br>";
4323 dsc_str += desc;
4324 if(md->type->InheritsFormal(TA_class) &&
4325 (md->type->HasOption("INLINE") || md->type->HasOption("EDIT_INLINE"))) {
4326 indent += " ";
4327 for (int i=0; i < md->type->members.size; ++i) {
4328 MemberDef* smd = md->type->members.FastEl(i);
4329 if (!smd->ShowMember(taMisc::show_gui, TypeItem::SC_EDIT) ||
4330 smd->HasOption("HIDDEN_INLINE"))
4331 continue;
4332 GetMembDesc(smd, dsc_str, indent);
4333 }
4334 }
4335 else if (md->type->InheritsFormal(TA_enum)) {
4336 for (int i = 0; i < md->type->enum_vals.size; ++i) {
4337 EnumDef* ed = md->type->enum_vals.FastEl(i);
4338 if (ed->desc.empty() || (ed->desc == " ") || (ed->desc == " ")) continue;
4339 if (ed->HasOption("NO_BIT") || ed->HasOption("NO_SHOW") || ed->HasOption("HIDDEN")) continue;
4340 desc = indent + " * " + ed->GetLabel() + StringtaString(": ") + ed->desc;
4341 if (!dsc_str.empty())
4342 dsc_str += "<br>";
4343 dsc_str += desc;
4344 }
4345 }
4346}
4347
4348void MemberDef::Initialize() {
4349 off = NULL__null;
4350 base_off = 0;
4351 addr = NULL__null;
4352 fun_ptr = false;
4353}
4354
4355MemberDef::MemberDef()
4356:inherited()
4357{
4358 Initialize();
4359}
4360
4361MemberDef::MemberDef(const char* nm)
4362:inherited(nm)
4363{
4364 Initialize();
4365}
4366
4367MemberDef::MemberDef(TypeDef* ty, const char* nm, const char* dsc,
4368 const char* op, const char* lis, ta_memb_ptr mptr, bool is_stat,
4369 void* maddr, bool funp)
4370:inherited(ty, nm, dsc, op, lis, is_stat)
4371{
4372 Initialize();
4373 off = mptr; addr = maddr; fun_ptr = funp;
4374}
4375
4376MemberDef::MemberDef(const MemberDef& cp)
4377:inherited(cp)
4378{
4379 Initialize();
4380 Copy_(cp);
4381}
4382
4383void MemberDef::Copy(const MemberDef& cp) {
4384 inherited::Copy(cp);
4385 Copy_(cp);
4386}
4387
4388void MemberDef::Copy_(const MemberDef& cp) {
4389 off = cp.off;
4390 base_off = cp.base_off;
4391 addr = cp.addr;
4392 fun_ptr = cp.fun_ptr;
4393}
4394
4395MemberDef::~MemberDef() {
4396}
4397
4398void* MemberDef::GetOff(const void* base) const {
4399 void* rval = addr;
4400 if (!is_static)
4401 rval = (void*)&((ta_memb_ptr_class*)((char*)base+base_off)->*off);
4402 return rval;
4403}
4404
4405void* MemberDef::GetOff_static(const void* base, int base_off_, ta_memb_ptr off_) {
4406 return (void*)&((ta_memb_ptr_class*)((char*)base+base_off_)->*off_);
4407}
4408
4409const StringtaString MemberDef::GetPathName() const {
4410 StringtaString rval;
4411 TypeDef* owtp = GetOwnerType();
4412 if (owtp)
4413 rval = owtp->GetPathName();
4414 rval += "::" + name;
4415 return rval;
4416}
4417
4418const Variant MemberDef::GetValVar(const void* base) const {
4419 return type->GetValVar(GetOff(base), this);
4420}
4421
4422MemberDef::DefaultStatus MemberDef::GetDefaultStatus(const void* base) {
4423 StringtaString defval = OptionAfter("DEF_");
4424 if (defval.empty()) return NO_DEF;
4425 StringtaString cur_val = type->GetValStr(GetOff(base));
4426 // hack for , in real numbers in international settings
4427 // note: we would probably never have a variant member with float default
4428 if (type->DerivesFrom(TA_float) || type->DerivesFrom(TA_double)) {
4429 cur_val.gsub(",", "."); // does a makeUnique
4430 }
4431 if(defval.contains(';')) { // enumerated set of values specified
4432 StringtaString dv1 = defval.before(';');
4433 StringtaString dvr = defval.after(';');
4434 while(true) {
4435 if(cur_val == dv1) return EQU_DEF;
4436 if(dvr.contains(';')) {
4437 dv1 = dvr.before(';');
4438 dvr = dvr.after(';');
4439 continue;
4440 }
4441 return (cur_val == dvr) ? EQU_DEF : NOT_DEF;
4442 }
4443 }
4444 else if(defval.contains(':')) { // range of values specified -- must be numeric
4445 StringtaString dv1 = defval.before(':');
4446 StringtaString dvr = defval.after(':');
4447 double cv = (double)cur_val; // just use double because it should do the trick for anything
4448 double dvl = (double)dv1;
4449 double dvh = (double)dvr;
4450 return (cv >= dvl && cv <= dvh) ? EQU_DEF : NOT_DEF;
4451 }
4452 else {
4453 return (cur_val == defval) ? EQU_DEF : NOT_DEF;
4454 }
4455}
4456
4457
4458bool MemberDef::isReadOnly() const {
4459 return HasOption("READ_ONLY");
4460}
4461
4462bool MemberDef::isGuiReadOnly() const {
4463 return (HasOption("READ_ONLY") || HasOption("GUI_READ_ONLY"));
4464}
4465
4466void MemberDef::SetValVar(const Variant& val, void* base, void* par) {
4467 return type->SetValVar(val, GetOff(base), par, this);
4468}
4469
4470bool MemberDef::ValIsDefault(const void* base, int for_show) const {
4471 StringtaString defval = OptionAfter("DEF_");
4472 void* mbr_base = GetOff(base);
4473 // if it has an explicit default, compare using the string
4474 // we do this regardless whether it is a simple value, or an object
4475 if (defval.nonempty()) {
4476 StringtaString act_val = type->GetValStr(mbr_base);
4477 return (act_val == defval);
4478 }
4479 // otherwise, delegate to the type -- objects recurse into us
4480 // if a default value was specified, compare and set the highlight accordingly
4481 return type->ValIsDefault(mbr_base, this, for_show);
4482}
4483
4484
4485StringtaString MemberDef::GetHTML(bool gendoc, bool short_fmt) const {
4486 STRING_BUF(rval, (short_fmt ? 100 : 300))taString rval(0, (short_fmt ? 100 : 300), '\0'); // extends if needed
4487 StringtaString own_typ;
4488 TypeDef* ot = GetOwnerType();
4489 if(ot) {
4490 own_typ.cat(ot->name).cat("::");
4491 }
4492 if(short_fmt) {
4493 rval.cat("<b><a href=#").cat(name).cat(">").cat(name).cat("</a></b> : ").cat(type->Get_C_Name());
4494 if(fun_ptr) rval.cat("(*)"); // function pointer indicator
4495 if(is_static) rval.cat("&nbsp;&nbsp;<tt> [static]</tt>");
4496 }
4497 else {
4498 rval.cat("<h3 class=\"fn\"><a name=\"").cat(name).cat("\"></a>").cat(own_typ).cat(name).cat(" : ");
4499 rval.cat(type->GetHTMLLink(gendoc));
4500 if(fun_ptr) rval.cat("(*)"); // function pointer indicator
4501 if(is_static) rval.cat("&nbsp;&nbsp;<tt> [static]</tt>");
4502 rval.cat("</h3>\n");
4503 rval.cat("<p>").cat(trim(desc).xml_esc()).cat("</p>\n");
4504 if(taMisc::help_detail >= taMisc::HD_DETAILS) {
4505 rval.cat("<p> Size: ").cat(StringtaString(type->size)).cat("</p>\n");
4506 if(opts.size > 0) {
4507 rval.cat("<p>").cat(GetOptsHTML()).cat("</p>\n");
4508 }
4509 }
4510 }
4511 return rval;
4512}
4513
4514//////////////////////////////////
4515// PropertyDef //
4516//////////////////////////////////
4517
4518void PropertyDef::Initialize() {
4519#ifdef NO_TA_BASE
4520 get_mbr = NULL__null;
4521 get_mth = NULL__null;
4522 set_mbr = NULL__null;
4523 set_mth = NULL__null;
4524#endif
4525 prop_get = NULL__null;
4526 prop_set = NULL__null;
4527}
4528
4529PropertyDef::PropertyDef()
4530:inherited()
4531{
4532 Initialize();
4533}
4534
4535PropertyDef::PropertyDef(const char* nm)
4536:inherited(nm)
4537{
4538 Initialize();
4539}
4540
4541PropertyDef::PropertyDef(TypeDef* ty, const char* nm, const char* dsc,
4542 const char* op, const char* lis, ta_prop_get_fun get, ta_prop_set_fun set,
4543 bool is_stat)
4544:inherited(ty, nm, dsc, op, lis, is_stat)
4545{
4546 Initialize();
4547 prop_get = get;
4548 prop_set = set;
4549}
4550
4551PropertyDef::PropertyDef(const PropertyDef& cp)
4552:inherited(cp)
4553{
4554 Initialize();
4555 Copy_(cp);
4556}
4557
4558PropertyDef::~PropertyDef() {
4559#ifdef NO_TA_BASE
4560 SetRefDone(*((taRefN**)&get_mbr), NULL__null);
4561 SetRefDone(*((taRefN**)&get_mth), NULL__null);
4562 SetRefDone(*((taRefN**)&set_mbr), NULL__null);
4563 SetRefDone(*((taRefN**)&set_mth), NULL__null);
4564#endif
4565}
4566
4567void PropertyDef::Copy(const PropertyDef& cp) {
4568 inherited::Copy(cp);
4569 Copy_(cp);
4570}
4571
4572void PropertyDef::Copy_(const PropertyDef& cp) {
4573 prop_get = cp.prop_get;
4574 prop_set =cp.prop_set;
4575}
4576
4577/*nn?? const String PropertyDef::GetPathName() const {
4578 String rval;
4579 TypeDef* owtp = GetOwnerType();
4580 if (owtp)
4581 rval = owtp->GetPathName();
4582 rval += "::" + name;
4583 return rval;
4584} */
4585
4586const Variant PropertyDef::GetValVar(const void* base) const {
4587 if (prop_get)
4588 return prop_get(base);
4589 else return _nilVariantVariant();
4590}
4591
4592bool PropertyDef::isReadOnly() const {
4593 return (prop_set == NULL__null);
4594}
4595
4596bool PropertyDef::isGuiReadOnly() const {
4597 return isReadOnly();
4598}
4599
4600void PropertyDef::SetValVar(const Variant& val, void* base, void* par) {
4601 if (prop_set)
4602 prop_set(base, val);
4603}
4604
4605bool PropertyDef::ValIsDefault(const void* base, int for_show) const {
4606 StringtaString defval = OptionAfter("DEF_");
4607 Variant val = GetValVar(base);
4608 // if it has an explicit default, compare using the string
4609 // we do this regardless whether it is a simple value, or an object
4610 if (defval.nonempty()) {
4611 return (val.toString() == defval);
4612 }
4613 // otherwise, just accept if it is the simple type
4614 return val.isDefault();
4615}
4616
4617StringtaString PropertyDef::GetHTML(bool gendoc, bool short_fmt) const {
4618 // todo: accessor functions, etc
4619 // todo: fun_ptr!
4620 STRING_BUF(rval, (short_fmt ? 100 : 300))taString rval(0, (short_fmt ? 100 : 300), '\0'); // extends if needed
4621 StringtaString own_typ;
4622 TypeDef* ot = GetOwnerType();
4623 if(ot) {
4624 own_typ.cat(ot->name).cat("::");
4625 }
4626 if(short_fmt) {
4627 rval.cat("<b><a href=#").cat(name).cat(">").cat(name).cat("</a></b> : ").cat(type->Get_C_Name());
4628 }
4629 else {
4630 rval.cat("<h3 class=\"fn\"><a name=\"").cat(name).cat("\"></a>").cat(own_typ).cat(name).cat(" : ");
4631 rval.cat(type->GetHTMLLink(gendoc)).cat("</h3>\n");
4632 rval.cat("<p>").cat(trim(desc).xml_esc()).cat("</p>\n");
4633 if(taMisc::help_detail >= taMisc::HD_DETAILS) {
4634 rval.cat("<p> Size: ").cat(StringtaString(type->size)).cat("</p>\n");
4635 if(opts.size > 0) {
4636 rval.cat("<p>").cat(GetOptsHTML()).cat("</p>\n");
4637 }
4638 }
4639 }
4640 return rval;
4641}
4642
4643//////////////////////////////////
4644// MethodDef //
4645//////////////////////////////////
4646
4647void MethodDef::Initialize() {
4648 owner = NULL__null;
4649 type = NULL__null;
4650 is_static = false;
4651 is_virtual = false;
4652 is_override = false;
4653 is_lexhide = false;
4654 addr = NULL__null;
4655#ifdef TA_GUI1
4656 im = NULL__null;
4657#endif
4658 fun_overld = 0;
4659 fun_argc = 0;
4660 fun_argd = -1;
4661 stubp = NULL__null;
4662
4663 arg_types.name = "arg_types";
4664 arg_types.owner = (TypeDef*)this; // this isn't quite right, is it..
4665 show_any = 0;
4666}
4667
4668MethodDef::MethodDef()
4669:inherited()
4670{
4671 Initialize();
4672}
4673
4674MethodDef::MethodDef(const char* nm)
4675:inherited()
4676{
4677 Initialize();
4678 name = nm;
4679}
4680
4681MethodDef::MethodDef(TypeDef* ty, const char* nm, const char* dsc, const char* op, const char* lis,
4682 int fover, int farc, int fard, bool is_stat, ta_void_fun funa,
4683 css_fun_stub_ptr stb, bool is_virt)
4684:inherited()
4685{
4686 Initialize();
4687 type = ty; name = nm; desc = dsc;
4688 taMisc::CharToStrArray(opts,op);
4689 taMisc::CharToStrArray(lists,lis);
4690 fun_overld = fover; fun_argc = farc; fun_argd = fard;
4691 is_static = is_stat; addr = funa; stubp = stb;
4692 is_virtual = is_virt; // note: gets further processed, will get set if this is an override
4693 // without explicit virtual keyword
4694}
4695
4696MethodDef::MethodDef(const MethodDef& cp)
4697:inherited(cp)
4698{
4699 Initialize();
4700 Copy(cp);
4701}
4702
4703MethodDef::~MethodDef() {
4704#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
4705# ifndef NO_TA_GUI
4706 taRefN::SafeUnRefDone(im);
4707 im = NULL__null;
4708# endif
4709#endif
4710}
4711
4712void MethodDef::Copy(const MethodDef& cp) {
4713 inherited::Copy(cp);
4714 type = cp.type;
4715 is_static = cp.is_static;
4716 is_virtual = cp.is_virtual;
4717 is_override = cp.is_override;
4718 is_lexhide = cp.is_lexhide;
4719 addr = cp.addr;
4720 inh_opts = cp.inh_opts;
4721 // don't delete because delete is not ref counted
4722// im = cp.im;
4723 fun_overld = cp.fun_overld;
4724 fun_argc = cp.fun_argc;
4725 fun_argd = cp.fun_argd;
4726 arg_types = cp.arg_types;
4727 arg_names = cp.arg_names;
4728 arg_defs = cp.arg_defs;
4729 arg_vals = cp.arg_vals;
4730 stubp = cp.stubp;
4731 show_any = 0; //rebuild
4732}
4733
4734bool MethodDef::CheckList(const String_PArray& lst) const {
4735 int i;
4736 for(i=0; i<lists.size; i++) {
4737 if(lst.FindEl(lists.FastEl(i)) >= 0)
4738 return true;
4739 }
4740 return false;
4741}
4742
4743bool MethodDef::CompareArgs(MethodDef* it) const {
4744 if(fun_argc != it->fun_argc)
4745 return false;
4746 int i;
4747 for(i=0; i<fun_argc; i++) {
4748 if(arg_types[i] != it->arg_types[i])
4749 return false;
4750 }
4751 return true;
4752}
4753
4754void MethodDef::CallFun(void* base) const {
4755#if !defined(NO_TA_BASE) && defined(TA_GUI1)
4756 taiMethodData* mth_rep = NULL__null;
4757 if (taMisc::gui_active && (im != NULL__null)) {
4758 //TODO: following may not work, because it doesn't have enough context to pass to the routine
4759 mth_rep = im->GetGenericMethodRep(base, NULL__null);
4760 }
4761 if(mth_rep != NULL__null) {
4762 ++taMisc::in_gui_call;
4763 mth_rep->CallFun();
4764 --taMisc::in_gui_call;
4765 delete mth_rep;
4766 }
4767 else {
4768 if((fun_argc == 0) || (fun_argd == 0)) {
4769 ++taMisc::in_gui_call;
4770 cssEl* rval = (*(stubp))(base, 0, (cssEl**)NULL__null);
4771 if(rval) {
4772 cssEl::Ref(rval);
