4773 cssEl::unRefDone(rval);
4774 }
4775 --taMisc::in_gui_call;
4776 }
4777 else {
4778 taMisc::Warning("*** CallFun Error: function:", name,
4779 "not available, because args are required and no dialog requestor can be opened",
4780 "(must be gui, and function must have #MENU or #BUTTON");
4781 return;
4782 }
4783 }
4784#endif
4785}
4786
4787const StringtaString MethodDef::GetPathName() const {
4788 StringtaString rval;
4789 TypeDef* owtp = GetOwnerType();
4790 if (owtp)
4791 rval = owtp->GetPathName();
4792 rval += "::" + name;
4793 return rval;
4794}
4795
4796const StringtaString MethodDef::ParamsAsString() const {
4797 if (arg_types.size == 0) return _nilStringtaString();
4798 STRING_BUF(rval, arg_types.size * 20)taString rval(0, arg_types.size * 20, '\0');
4799 StringtaString arg_def;
4800 for (int i = 0; i < arg_types.size; ++i) {
4801 if (i > 0) rval += ", ";
4802 TypeDef* arg_typ = arg_types.FastEl(i);
4803 rval += arg_typ->Get_C_Name() + " ";
4804 rval += arg_names.FastEl(i);
4805 arg_def = arg_defs.FastEl(i); //note: same string used in original definition
4806 if (arg_def.length() > 0) {
4807 rval += " = " + arg_def;
4808 }
4809 }
4810 return rval;
4811}
4812
4813const StringtaString MethodDef::prototype() const {
4814 STRING_BUF(rval, 80)taString rval(0, 80, '\0'); // expands if necessary
4815 rval.cat(type->name).cat(' ').cat(name).cat('(');
4816 for (int i = 0; i < arg_names.size; ++i) {
4817 if (i > 0) rval.cat(", ");
4818 rval.cat(arg_types[i]->Get_C_Name()).cat(' ');
4819 rval.cat(arg_names[i]);
4820 StringtaString def = arg_defs[i];
4821 if (def.nonempty())
4822 rval.cat(" = ").cat(def);
4823 }
4824 rval.cat(')');
4825 return rval;
4826}
4827
4828bool MethodDef::ShowMethod(taMisc::ShowMembs show) const
4829{
4830 if (show & taMisc::USE_SHOW_GUI_DEF)
4831 show = taMisc::show_gui;
4832
4833 // check if cache has been done yet
4834 if (show_any == 0) ShowMethod_CalcCache();
4835 byte show_eff = show_any;
4836
4837 // our show_eff is the positives (what it is) so if there is nothing there, then
4838 // we clearly can't show
4839 // if there is something (a positive) then bit-AND with the
4840 // show, which is negatives (what not to show), and if anything remains, don't show!
4841 show_eff &= (byte)taMisc::SHOW_CHECK_MASK;
4842 return (show_eff) && !(show_eff & (byte)show);
4843}
4844
4845void MethodDef::ShowMethod_CalcCache() const {
4846 // note that "normal" is a special case, which depends both on context and
4847 // on whether other bits are set, so we calc those individually
4848 show_any = taMisc::IS_NORMAL; // the default for any
4849 ShowMethod_CalcCache_impl(show_any);
4850
4851}
4852
4853void MethodDef::ShowMethod_CalcCache_impl(byte& show) const {
4854 show |= 0x80; // set the "done" flag
4855
4856 //note: keep in mind that these show bits are the opposite of the show flags,
4857 // i.e show flags are all negative, whereas these are all positive (bit = is that type)
4858
4859 //note: member flags should generally trump type flags, so you can SHOW a NO_SHOW type
4860 //note: NO_SHOW is special, since it negates, so we check for base NO_SHOW everywhere
4861 //MethodDef note: SHOW is implied in any of: MENU BUTTON or MENU_CONTEXT
4862 bool typ_show = type->HasOption("METH_SHOW");
4863 bool typ_no_show = type->HasOption("METH_NO_SHOW") || type->HasOption("METH_NO_SHOW");
4864 bool mth_show = HasOption("SHOW") || HasOption("MENU") ||
4865 HasOption("BUTTON") || HasOption("MENU_CONTEXT") || HasOption("MENU_BUTTON");
4866 bool mth_no_show = HasOption("NO_SHOW") || HasOption("NO_SHOW");
4867
4868 // ok, so no explicit SHOW or NO_SHOW, so we do the special checks
4869 // you can't "undo" type-level specials, but you can always mark SHOW on the mth
4870
4871 // the following are all cumulative, not mutually exclusive
4872 if (HasOption("HIDDEN") || type->HasOption("METH_HIDDEN"))
4873 show |= (byte)taMisc::IS_HIDDEN;
4874 if ((HasOption("READ_ONLY") || HasOption("GUI_READ_ONLY")) && !mth_show)
4875 show |= (byte)taMisc::IS_HIDDEN;
4876 if (HasOption("EXPERT") || type->HasOption("METH_EXPERT"))
4877 show |= (byte)taMisc::IS_EXPERT;
4878
4879// String cat = OptionAfter("CAT_");
4880// if(cat.contains("Xpert")) // special code for expert -- no need for redundant #EXPERT flag
4881// show |= (byte)taMisc::IS_EXPERT;
4882
4883 // if NO_SHOW and no SHOW or explicit other, then never shows
4884 if (mth_no_show || (typ_no_show && (!mth_show || (show & (byte)taMisc::NORM_MEMBS)))) {
4885 show &= (byte)(0x80 | ~taMisc::SHOW_CHECK_MASK);
4886 return;
4887 }
4888
4889 // if any of the special guys are set, we unset NORMAL (which may
4890 // or may not have been already set by default)
4891 if (show & (byte)taMisc::NORM_MEMBS) // in "any" context, default is "normal"
4892 show &= ~(byte)taMisc::IS_NORMAL;
4893 else // no non-NORMAL set
4894 // SHOW is like an explicit NORMAL if nothing else applies
4895 if (mth_show || typ_show)
4896 show |= (byte)taMisc::IS_NORMAL;
4897}
4898
4899StringtaString MethodDef::GetHTML(bool gendoc, bool short_fmt) const {
4900 STRING_BUF(rval, (short_fmt ? 100 : 300))taString rval(0, (short_fmt ? 100 : 300), '\0'); // extends if needed
4901 StringtaString own_typ;
4902 TypeDef* ot = GetOwnerType();
4903 if(ot) {
4904 own_typ.cat(ot->name).cat("::");
4905 }
4906 if(short_fmt) {
4907 rval.cat(type->Get_C_Name()).cat(" <b><a href=#").cat(name).cat(">").cat(own_typ).cat(name).cat("</a></b> ( ");
4908 for(int i = 0; i < arg_names.size; ++i) {
4909 if (i > 0) rval.cat(", ");
4910 rval.cat(arg_types[i]->Get_C_Name()).cat(' ');
4911 rval.cat("<i>").cat(arg_names[i]).cat("</i>");
4912 StringtaString def = arg_defs[i];
4913 if (def.nonempty())
4914 rval.cat(" = ").cat(trim(def).xml_esc());
4915 }
4916 rval.cat(" )");
4917 if(is_static) rval.cat("&nbsp;&nbsp;<tt> [static]</tt>");
4918 }
4919 else {
4920 rval.cat("<h3 class=\"fn\"><a name=\"").cat(name).cat("\"></a>");
4921 rval.cat(type->GetHTMLLink(gendoc)).cat(" ").cat(own_typ).cat(name).cat(" ( ");
4922 for(int i = 0; i < arg_names.size; ++i) {
4923 if (i > 0) rval.cat(", ");
4924 rval.cat(arg_types[i]->GetHTMLLink(gendoc)).cat(' ');
4925 rval.cat("<i>").cat(arg_names[i]).cat("</i>");
4926 StringtaString def = arg_defs[i];
4927 if (def.nonempty())
4928 rval.cat(" = ").cat(trim(def).xml_esc());
4929 }
4930 rval.cat(" )");
4931 if(is_static) rval.cat("&nbsp;&nbsp;<tt> [static]</tt>");
4932 rval.cat("</h3>\n");
4933 rval += "<p>" + trim(desc).xml_esc() + "</p>\n";
4934 if(taMisc::help_detail >= taMisc::HD_DETAILS) {
4935 if(opts.size > 0) {
4936 rval.cat("<p>").cat(GetOptsHTML()).cat("</p>\n");
4937 }
4938 }
4939 rval.cat("<span class=\"fakelink\" onclick='writesrc(this,\"");
4940 rval.cat(type->Get_C_Name()).cat(" ").cat(own_typ).cat(name).cat("\")'>Show Source Code</span><br>\n");
4941 }
4942 return rval;
4943}
4944
4945//////////////////////////
4946// TypeDef //
4947//////////////////////////
4948
4949TypeDef* TypeDef::GetCommonSubtype(TypeDef* typ1, TypeDef* typ2) {
4950 // search up typ1's tree until a common subtype is found
4951 // note: doesn't matter which obj's tree we go up, so we just pick typ1
4952 TypeDef* rval = typ1;
4953 while (rval && (!typ2->InheritsFrom(rval))) {
4954 // note: we only search up the primary inheritance hierarchy
4955 rval = rval->parents.SafeEl(0);
4956 }
4957 return rval;
4958}
4959
4960void TypeDef::Initialize() {
4961 owner = NULL__null;
4962 size = 0;
4963 ptr = 0;
4964 ref = false;
4965 internal = false;
4966 formal = false;
4967
4968#ifdef TA_GUI1
4969 it = NULL__null;
4970 ie = NULL__null;
4971 iv = NULL__null;
4972#endif
4973#ifdef NO_TA_BASE
4974 pre_parsed = false; // true if previously parsed by maketa
4975#else
4976 is_subclass = false;
4977 plugin = NULL__null; // set true by TypeSpace::SetOwner if initing a plugin
4978 instance = NULL__null;
4979 defaults = NULL__null;
4980 schema = NULL__null;
4981#endif
4982
4983 parents.name = "parents";
4984 parents.owner = this;
4985 par_formal.name = "par_formal";
4986 par_formal.owner = this;
4987 par_cache.name = "par_cache";
4988 par_cache.owner = this;
4989 children.name = "children";
4990 children.owner = this;
4991 tokens.name = "tokens";
4992 tokens.owner = this;
4993
4994 enum_vals.name = "enum_vals";
4995 enum_vals.owner = this;
4996 sub_types.name = "sub_types";
4997 sub_types.owner = this;
4998 members.name = "members";
4999 members.owner = this;
5000 properties.name = "properties";
5001 properties.owner = this;
5002 methods.name = "methods";
5003 methods.owner = this;
5004 templ_pars.name = "templ_pars";
5005 templ_pars.owner = this;
5006 m_cacheInheritsNonAtomicClass = 0;
5007#if (!defined(NO_TA_BASE) && defined(DMEM_COMPILE))
5008 dmem_type = NULL__null;
5009#endif
5010}
5011
5012TypeDef::TypeDef()
5013:inherited()
5014{
5015 Initialize();
5016}
5017
5018TypeDef::TypeDef(const char* nm)
5019:inherited()
5020{
5021 Initialize();
5022 name = nm;
5023}
5024
5025#ifdef NO_TA_BASE
5026TypeDef::TypeDef(const char* nm, const char* dsc, const char* inop, const char* op, const char* lis,
5027 uint siz, int ptrs, bool refnc, bool global_obj)
5028#else
5029TypeDef::TypeDef(const char* nm, const char* dsc, const char* inop, const char* op, const char* lis,
5030 uint siz, void** inst, bool toks, int ptrs, bool refnc, bool global_obj)
5031#endif
5032:inherited()
5033{
5034 Initialize();
5035#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
5036 instance = inst;
5037 tokens.keep = toks;
5038#endif
5039 name = nm; desc = dsc;
5040 c_name = nm;
5041 taMisc::CharToStrArray(opts,op);
5042 taMisc::CharToStrArray(inh_opts,inop);
5043 taMisc::CharToStrArray(lists,lis);
5044#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
5045 CleanupCats(true); // save the last one for initialization
5046#endif
5047 size = siz;
5048 ptr = ptrs;
5049 ref = refnc;
5050 if(global_obj)
5051 taRefN::Ref(this); // reference if static (non-new'ed) global object
5052}
5053
5054TypeDef::TypeDef(const char* nm, bool intrnl, int ptrs, bool refnc, bool forml,
5055 bool global_obj, uint siz, const char* c_nm
5056)
5057:inherited()
5058{
5059 Initialize();
5060 name = nm; internal = intrnl; ptr = ptrs; ref = refnc; formal = forml;
5061 size = siz; // note: may get updated later
5062 if (c_nm) c_name = c_nm;
5063 else c_name = name;
5064 if(ptr > 0) size = sizeof(void*);
5065 if(global_obj)
5066 taRefN::Ref(this); // reference if static (non-new'ed) global object
5067}
5068
5069TypeDef::TypeDef(const TypeDef& cp)
5070:inherited(cp)
5071{
5072 Initialize();
5073 Copy_(cp);
5074}
5075
5076void TypeDef::Copy(const TypeDef& cp) {
5077 inherited::Copy(cp);
5078 Copy_(cp);
5079}
5080
5081void TypeDef::Copy_(const TypeDef& cp) {
5082#ifdef NO_TA_BASE
5083 pre_parsed = cp.pre_parsed;
5084#else
5085 is_subclass = cp.is_subclass;
5086 plugin = cp.plugin;
5087 instance = cp.instance ;
5088 //TODO: copy the schema
5089// don't copy the tokens..
5090#endif
5091 c_name = cp.c_name;
5092 size = cp.size ;
5093 ptr = cp.ptr ;
5094 ref = cp.ref ;
5095 internal = cp.internal;
5096 formal = cp.formal ;
5097
5098 inh_opts = cp.inh_opts ;
5099
5100 parents = cp.parents ;
5101 par_formal = cp.par_formal;
5102 par_cache = cp.par_cache;
5103 children = cp.children ; // not sure about this one..
5104
5105// don't copy the it's
5106// it = cp.it ;
5107// ie = cp.ie ;
5108// or the defaults
5109// defaults = cp.defaults ;
5110
5111 enum_vals = cp.enum_vals;
5112 // sub_types = cp.sub_types;
5113 sub_types.Duplicate(cp.sub_types);// important: add to subtypes..
5114 members = cp.members;
5115 properties = cp.properties;
5116 methods = cp.methods;
5117 templ_pars = cp.templ_pars;
5118
5119 sub_types.ReplaceParents(cp.sub_types, sub_types); // make our sub types consistent
5120 DuplicateMDFrom(&cp); // duplicate members owned by source
5121 UpdateMDTypes(cp.sub_types, sub_types); // since sub-types are new, point to them
5122}
5123
5124TypeDef::~TypeDef() {
5125#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
5126# ifdef DMEM_COMPILE
5127 if (dmem_type) {
5128 delete (MPI_Datatype_PArray*)dmem_type;
5129 dmem_type = NULL__null;
5130 }
5131# endif
5132 if (defaults) {
5133 taBase::UnRef(defaults);
5134 defaults = NULL__null;
5135 }
5136 if (schema) {
5137 delete schema;
5138 schema = NULL__null;
5139 }
5140# ifndef NO_TA_GUI
5141 taRefN::SafeUnRefDone(it); it = NULL__null;
5142 if (ie) {delete ie; ie = NULL__null;}
5143 if (iv) {delete iv; iv = NULL__null;}
5144# endif // !NO_TA_GUI
5145#endif // !NO_TA_BASE
5146 if((owner == &taMisc::types) && !taMisc::not_constr) // destroying..
5147 taMisc::not_constr = true;
5148}
5149
5150#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
5151void TypeDef::AddUserDataSchema(UserDataItemBase* item) {
5152 if (!schema) {
5153 schema = new UserDataItem_List;
5154 }
5155 schema->Add(item);
5156}
5157#endif
5158
5159void TypeDef::CleanupCats(bool save_last) {
5160 if(save_last) {
5161 bool got_op = false;
5162 for(int i=opts.size-1; i>=0; i--) {
5163 StringtaString op = opts[i];
5164 if(!op.contains("CAT_")) continue;
5165 if(got_op) {
5166 opts.RemoveIdx(i);
5167 } // remove all other previous ones
5168 else got_op = true;
5169 }
5170 got_op = false;
5171 for(int i=inh_opts.size-1; i>=0; i--) {
5172 StringtaString op = inh_opts[i];
5173 if(!op.contains("CAT_")) continue;
5174 if(got_op) {
5175 inh_opts.RemoveIdx(i);
5176 } // remove all other previous ones
5177 else got_op = true;
5178 }
5179 }
5180 else { // save first
5181 bool got_op = false;
5182 for(int i=0; i< opts.size;i++) {
5183 StringtaString op = opts[i];
5184 if(!op.contains("CAT_")) continue;
5185 if(got_op) { opts.RemoveIdx(i); i--; } // remove all other previous ones
5186 else got_op = true;
5187 }
5188 got_op = false;
5189 for(int i=0; i<inh_opts.size;i++) {
5190 StringtaString op = inh_opts[i];
5191 if(!op.contains("CAT_")) continue;
5192 if(got_op) {inh_opts.RemoveIdx(i); i--; } // remove all other previous ones
5193 else got_op = true;
5194 }
5195 }
5196}
5197
5198void TypeDef::DuplicateMDFrom(const TypeDef* old) {
5199 int i;
5200 for(i=0; i<members.size; i++) {
5201 MemberDef* md = members.FastEl(i);
5202 if(md->owner == &(old->members))
5203 members.ReplaceIdx(i, md->Clone());
5204 }
5205 for(i=0; i<methods.size; i++) {
5206 MethodDef* md = methods.FastEl(i);
5207 if(md->owner == &(old->methods))
5208 methods.ReplaceIdx(i, md->Clone());
5209 }
5210}
5211
5212bool TypeDef::InheritsNonAtomicClass() const {
5213 if (m_cacheInheritsNonAtomicClass == 0) {
5214 // set cache
5215 m_cacheInheritsNonAtomicClass = (InheritsFormal(TA_class)
5216 && !InheritsFrom(TA_taString)
5217 && !InheritsFrom(TA_Variant)
5218#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
5219 && !InheritsFrom(TA_taSmartPtr)
5220 && !InheritsFrom(TA_taSmartRef)
5221# if TA_USE_QT1
5222 && !InheritsFrom(TA_QAtomicInt)
5223# endif
5224#endif
5225 ) ? 1 : -1;
5226 }
5227 return (m_cacheInheritsNonAtomicClass == 1);
5228}
5229
5230bool TypeDef::IsBasePointerType() const {
5231#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
5232 if(((ptr == 1) && DerivesFrom(TA_taBase)) ||
5233 ((ptr == 0) && (DerivesFrom(TA_taSmartPtr) ||
5234 DerivesFrom(TA_taSmartRef))) )
5235 return true;
5236#endif
5237 return false;
5238}
5239
5240TypeDef* TypeDef::GetStemBase() const {
5241 if(HasOption("STEM_BASE")) return const_cast<TypeDef*>(this);
5242 // first breadth
5243 for(int i=0; i < parents.size; i++) {
5244 TypeDef* par = parents.FastEl(i);
5245 if(par->HasOption("STEM_BASE"))
5246 return par;
5247 }
5248 // then depth recursion
5249 for(int i=0; i < parents.size; i++) {
5250 TypeDef* rval = parents.FastEl(i)->GetStemBase();
5251 if(rval) return rval;
5252 }
5253 return NULL__null;
5254}
5255
5256void TypeDef::UpdateMDTypes(const TypeSpace& ol, const TypeSpace& nw) {
5257 int i;
5258 for(i=0; i<members.size; i++) {
5259 MemberDef* md = members.FastEl(i);
5260 if(md->owner != &members) // only for members we own
5261 continue;
5262
5263 int j;
5264 for(j=0; j<ol.size; j++) {
5265 TypeDef* old_st = ol.FastEl(j);
5266 TypeDef* new_st = nw.FastEl(j); // assumes one-to-one correspondence
5267
5268 if(md->type == old_st)
5269 md->type = new_st;
5270 }
5271 }
5272 for(i=0; i<methods.size; i++) {
5273 MethodDef* md = methods.FastEl(i);
5274 if(md->owner != &methods)
5275 continue;
5276
5277 int j;
5278 for(j=0; j<ol.size; j++) {
5279 TypeDef* old_st = ol.FastEl(j);
5280 TypeDef* new_st = nw.FastEl(j); // assumes one-to-one correspondence
5281
5282 if(md->type == old_st)
5283 md->type = new_st;
5284
5285 md->arg_types.ReplaceLinkAll(old_st, new_st);
5286 }
5287 }
5288}
5289
5290TypeDef* TypeDef::FindTypeWithMember(const char* nm, MemberDef** md){
5291 *md = members.FindName(nm);
5292 if (*md) return this;
5293
5294 for (int i = 0; i < children.size; i++) {
5295 if (TypeDef *td = children[i]->FindTypeWithMember(nm,md)) {
5296 return td;
5297 }
5298 }
5299 return NULL__null;
5300}
5301
5302bool TypeDef::CheckList(const String_PArray& lst) const {
5303 for (int i = 0; i < lists.size; i++) {
5304 if (lst.FindEl(lists.FastEl(i)) >= 0)
5305 return true;
5306 }
5307 return false;
5308}
5309
5310
5311TypeDef* TypeDef::GetNonPtrType() const {
5312 if(ptr == 0) return const_cast<TypeDef*>(this);
5313
5314 TypeDef* rval = const_cast<TypeDef*>(this);
5315 while(rval->GetParent() != NULL__null) {
5316 rval = rval->GetParent();
5317 if(rval->ptr == 0)
5318 return rval;
5319 }
5320 return rval; // always return something
5321}
5322
5323TypeDef* TypeDef::GetNonRefType() const {
5324 if(!ref) return const_cast<TypeDef*>(this);
5325
5326 TypeDef* rval = const_cast<TypeDef*>(this);
5327 while(rval->GetParent() != NULL__null) {
5328 rval = rval->GetParent();
5329 if(!rval->ref)
5330 return rval;
5331 }
5332 return rval; // always return something
5333}
5334
5335TypeDef* TypeDef::GetTemplType() const {
5336 if(InheritsFormal(TA_template)) return const_cast<TypeDef*>(this);
5337
5338 TypeDef* rval = const_cast<TypeDef*>(this);
5339 while((rval = rval->GetParent()) != NULL__null) {
5340 if(rval->InheritsFormal(TA_template))
5341 return rval;
5342 }
5343 return NULL__null;
5344}
5345
5346TypeDef* TypeDef::GetTemplInstType() const {
5347 if(InheritsFormal(TA_templ_inst)) return const_cast<TypeDef*>(this);
5348
5349 TypeDef* rval = const_cast<TypeDef*>(this);
5350 while((rval = rval->GetParent()) != NULL__null) {
5351 if(rval->InheritsFormal(TA_templ_inst))
5352 return rval;
5353 }
5354 return NULL__null;
5355}
5356
5357TypeDef* TypeDef::GetNonConstType() const {
5358 if(!DerivesFrom(TA_const)) return const_cast<TypeDef*>(this);
5359
5360 TypeDef* rval = const_cast<TypeDef*>(this);
5361 while((rval = rval->parents.Peek()) != NULL__null) { // use the last parent, not the 1st
5362 if(!rval->DerivesFrom(TA_const))
5363 return rval;
5364 }
5365 return NULL__null;
5366}
5367
5368TypeDef* TypeDef::GetNonConstNonRefType() const {
5369 if(!(DerivesFrom(TA_const) || ref)) return const_cast<TypeDef*>(this);
5370
5371 TypeDef* rval = const_cast<TypeDef*>(this);
5372 while((rval = rval->parents.Peek()) != NULL__null) { // use the last parent, not the 1st
5373 if (!(rval->DerivesFrom(TA_const) || rval->ref))
5374 return rval;
5375 }
5376 return NULL__null;
5377}
5378
5379TypeDef* TypeDef::GetClassType() const {
5380 if(InheritsFormal(&TA_class)) return const_cast<TypeDef*>(this);
5381
5382 TypeDef* rval = const_cast<TypeDef*>(this);
5383 while((rval = rval->parents.Peek()) != NULL__null) { // use the last parent, not the 1st
5384 if(rval->InheritsFormal(&TA_class))
5385 return rval;
5386 }
5387 return NULL__null;
5388}
5389
5390TypeDef* TypeDef::GetPluginType() const {
5391#ifdef NO_TA_BASE
5392 return NULL__null;
5393#else
5394 return plugin;
5395#endif
5396}
5397
5398StringtaString TypeDef::GetPtrString() const {
5399 StringtaString rval; int i;
5400 for(i=0; i<ptr; i++) rval += "*";
5401 return rval;
5402}
5403
5404
5405StringtaString TypeDef::Get_C_Name() const {
5406 StringtaString rval;
5407 if(ref) {
5408 TypeDef *nrt = GetNonRefType();
5409 if (!nrt) {
5410 //taMisc::Error("Null NonRefType in TypeDef::Get_C_Name()", name);
5411 return name;
5412 }
5413 if (nrt == this) return name + "&";
5414 rval = nrt->Get_C_Name() + "&";
5415 return rval;
5416 }
5417
5418 if (ptr > 0) {
5419 TypeDef *npt = GetNonPtrType();
5420 if (!npt) {
5421 //taMisc::Error("Null NonPtrType in TypeDef::Get_C_Name()", name);
5422 return name;
5423 }
5424 if (npt == this) return name + GetPtrString();
5425 rval = npt->Get_C_Name() + GetPtrString();
5426 return rval;
5427 }
5428
5429 // combo type
5430 if ((parents.size > 1) && !InheritsFormal(TA_class)) {
5431 for (int i = 0; i < parents.size; i++) {
5432 TypeDef* pt = parents.FastEl(i);
5433 rval += pt->Get_C_Name();
5434 if (i < parents.size-1) rval += " ";
5435 }
5436 return rval;
5437 }
5438
5439 // on some local list and not internal
5440 // (which were not actually delcared at this scope anyway)
5441 if (!(internal) && (owner != NULL__null) && (owner->owner != NULL__null) && (owner->owner != this)) {
5442 rval = owner->owner->Get_C_Name() + "::";
5443 }
5444
5445 if (InheritsFormal(TA_templ_inst) && (templ_pars.size > 0)) {
5446 TypeDef* tmpar = GetTemplParent();
5447 if (!tmpar) {
5448 taMisc::Error("Null TemplParent in TypeDef::Get_C_Name()", name);
5449 return name;
5450 }
5451 rval += tmpar->name + "<"; // note: name is always its valid c_name
5452 for (int i = 0; i < templ_pars.size; i++) {
5453 rval += templ_pars.FastEl(i)->Get_C_Name();
5454 if (i < templ_pars.size-1)
5455 rval += ",";
5456 }
5457 rval += ">";
5458 return rval;
5459 }
5460
5461 //note: normally, c_name should be valid, but may be cases, ex. templates, dynamic types, etc
5462 // where c_name was not set or updated, so most contexts the name is the same
5463 if (c_name.empty())
5464 rval += name; // the default
5465 else
5466 rval += c_name; // the default
5467 return rval;
5468}
5469
5470TypeDef* TypeDef::AddParent(TypeDef* it, int p_off) {
5471 if(parents.LinkUnique(it))
5472 par_off.Add(p_off); // it was unique, add offset
5473 // only add to children if not internal (except when parent is)
5474 bool templ = InheritsFormal(TA_template); // cache
5475 if (templ || (!internal || it->internal))
5476 it->children.Link(this);
5477 // since templs don't call AddParClass, we have to determine
5478#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
5479 // if it is a subclass here...
5480 if (templ && it->InheritsFormal(TA_class))
5481 is_subclass = true;
5482#endif
5483
5484 opts.DupeUnique(it->inh_opts);
5485 inh_opts.DupeUnique(it->inh_opts); // and so on
5486
5487 if(InheritsFrom(TA_taBase))
5488 opts.AddUnique(opt_instance); // ta_bases always have an instance
5489
5490#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
5491 CleanupCats(false); // save first guy for add parent!
5492#endif
5493
5494 // no need to get all this junk for internals
5495 if(internal && !templ) return it;
5496
5497 // use the old one because the parent does not have precidence over existing
5498 enum_vals.BorrowUniqNameOld(it->enum_vals);
5499 sub_types.BorrowUniqNameOld(it->sub_types);
5500 members.BorrowUniqNameOld(it->members);
5501 properties.BorrowUniqNameOld(it->properties);
5502 methods.BorrowUniqNameOld(it->methods);
5503 return it;
5504}
5505
5506void TypeDef::AddParents(TypeDef* p1, TypeDef* p2, TypeDef* p3, TypeDef* p4,
5507 TypeDef* p5, TypeDef* p6) {
5508 if(p1 != NULL__null) AddParent(p1);
5509 if(p2 != NULL__null) AddParent(p2);
5510 if(p3 != NULL__null) AddParent(p3);
5511 if(p4 != NULL__null) AddParent(p4);
5512 if(p5 != NULL__null) AddParent(p5);
5513 if(p6 != NULL__null) AddParent(p6);
5514}
5515
5516void TypeDef::AddClassPar(TypeDef* p1, int p1_off, TypeDef* p2, int p2_off,
5517 TypeDef* p3, int p3_off, TypeDef* p4, int p4_off,
5518 TypeDef* p5, int p5_off, TypeDef* p6, int p6_off)
5519{
5520#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
5521 is_subclass = true;
5522#endif
5523 bool mi = false;
5524 if(p1 != NULL__null) AddParent(p1,p1_off);
5525 if(p2 != NULL__null) { AddParent(p2,p2_off); mi = true; }
5526 if(p3 != NULL__null) AddParent(p3,p3_off);
5527 if(p4 != NULL__null) AddParent(p4,p4_off);
5528 if(p5 != NULL__null) AddParent(p5,p5_off);
5529 if(p6 != NULL__null) AddParent(p6,p6_off);
5530
5531 if(mi) ComputeMembBaseOff();
5532}
5533
5534void TypeDef::AddParFormal(TypeDef* p1, TypeDef* p2, TypeDef* p3, TypeDef* p4,
5535 TypeDef* p5, TypeDef* p6) {
5536 if(p1 != NULL__null) par_formal.LinkUnique(p1);
5537 if(p2 != NULL__null) par_formal.LinkUnique(p2);
5538 if(p3 != NULL__null) par_formal.LinkUnique(p3);
5539 if(p4 != NULL__null) par_formal.LinkUnique(p4);
5540 if(p5 != NULL__null) par_formal.LinkUnique(p5);
5541 if(p6 != NULL__null) par_formal.LinkUnique(p6);
5542}
5543
5544void TypeDef::CacheParents() {
5545 par_cache.Reset(); // justin case
5546 for(int i=0; i<parents.size; i++) {
5547 parents.FastEl(i)->CacheParents_impl(this);
5548 }
5549 par_cache.BuildHashTable(par_cache.size + 2, taHashTable::KT_PTR); // little extra, cache on pointer vals
5550}
5551
5552void TypeDef::CacheParents_impl(TypeDef* src_typ) {
5553 src_typ->par_cache.LinkUnique(this);
5554 for(int i=0; i<parents.size; i++) {
5555 parents.FastEl(i)->CacheParents_impl(src_typ);
5556 }
5557}
5558
5559void TypeDef::ComputeMembBaseOff() {
5560 int i;
5561 for(i=0; i<members.size; i++) {
5562 MemberDef* md = members.FastEl(i);
5563 TypeDef* mo = md->GetOwnerType();
5564
5565 if((mo == this) || (mo == NULL__null))
5566 continue;
5567
5568 int base_off = GetParOff(mo);
5569 if(base_off > 0) { // only those that need it!
5570 MemberDef* nmd = md->Clone();
5571 nmd->base_off = base_off;
5572 members.ReplaceIdx(i, nmd);
5573 }
5574 else if(base_off < 0) {
5575 taMisc::Error("ComputeMembBaseOff(): parent type not found:",mo->name,
5576 "in type of:", name);
5577 }
5578 }
5579}
5580
5581bool TypeDef::FindChildName(const char* nm) const {
5582 if (children.FindName(nm))
5583 return true;
5584 for (int i = 0; i < children.size; i++) {
5585 if (children.FastEl(i)->FindChildName(nm))
5586 return true;
5587 }
5588 return false;
5589}
5590bool TypeDef::FindChild(TypeDef* it) const {
5591 if (children.FindEl(it) >= 0)
5592 return true;
5593 for (int i = 0; i < children.size; i++) {
5594 if (children.FastEl(i)->FindChild(it))
5595 return true;
5596 }
5597 return false;
5598}
5599
5600void* TypeDef::GetParAddr(const char* it, void* base) const {
5601 if (name == it) return base; // you are it!
5602 int anidx = parents.FindNameIdx(it);
5603 if (anidx >= 0) {
5604 return (void*)((char*)base + par_off[anidx]);
5605 }
5606 for (int i = 0; i < parents.size; i++) {
5607 void* nw_base = (void*)((char*)base + par_off[i]);
5608 void* rval = parents.FastEl(i)->GetParAddr(it, nw_base);
5609 if (rval) return rval;
5610 }
5611 return NULL__null;
5612}
5613
5614void* TypeDef::GetParAddr(TypeDef* it, void* base) const {
5615 if (it == this) return base; // you are it!
5616 int anidx = parents.FindEl(it);
5617 if (anidx >= 0) {
5618 return (void*)((char*)base + par_off[anidx]);
5619 }
5620 for (int i = 0; i < parents.size; i++) {
5621 void* nw_base = (void*)((char*)base + par_off[i]);
5622 void* rval = parents.FastEl(i)->GetParAddr(it, nw_base);
5623 if (rval) return rval;
5624 }
5625 return NULL__null;
5626}
5627
5628
5629int TypeDef::GetParOff(TypeDef* it, int boff) const {
5630 int use_boff = (boff >= 0) ? boff : 0;
5631 if (it == this) return use_boff; // you are it!
5632 int anidx = parents.FindEl(it);
5633 if (anidx >= 0) {
5634 return use_boff + par_off[anidx];
5635 }
5636 for (int i = 0; i < parents.size; i++) {
5637 int rval = parents.FastEl(i)->GetParOff(it, use_boff + par_off[i]);
5638 if (rval >= 0) return rval;
5639 }
5640 return -1;
5641}
5642
5643const StringtaString TypeDef::GetPathName() const {
5644//TODO: this routine may not even be used!
5645 // are we owned?
5646 // are we an EnumDef?
5647
5648 StringtaString rval;
5649 TypeDef* owtp = GetOwnerType();
5650 if (owtp) {
5651 rval = owtp->GetPathName() + "::";
5652 }
5653 rval += name;
5654 return rval;
5655}
5656
5657TypeDef* TypeDef::GetPtrType() const {
5658 TypeDef* rval = children.FindName(name + "_ptr");
5659 if (rval) {
5660 // make sure its ptr count is one more than ours!
5661 if (rval->ptr != (ptr + 1)) {
5662 rval = NULL__null;
5663 }
5664 }
5665 if (!rval) {
5666 // need to make one, we use same pattern as maketa
5667 rval = new TypeDef(name + "_ptr", internal, ptr + 1, 0, 0, 0);
5668 taMisc::types.Add(rval);
5669 // unconstify us, this is an internal operation, still considered "const" access
5670 rval->AddParent(const_cast<TypeDef*>(this));
5671 }
5672 return rval;
5673}
5674
5675StringtaString TypeDef::GetTemplName(const TypeSpace& inst_pars) const {
5676 StringtaString rval = name;
5677 int i;
5678 for(i=0; i<inst_pars.size; i++) {
5679 rval += StringtaString("_") + inst_pars.FastEl(i)->name + "_";
5680 }
5681 return rval;
5682}
5683
5684TypeDef* TypeDef::GetTemplParent() const {
5685 int i;
5686 for(i=0; i<parents.size; i++) {
5687 if(parents.FastEl(i)->InheritsFormal(TA_template))
5688 return parents.FastEl(i);
5689 }
5690 return NULL__null;
5691}
5692
5693bool TypeDef::IgnoreMeth(const StringtaString& nm) const {
5694 if(!InheritsFormal(TA_class))
5695 return false;
5696 if(ignore_meths.FindEl(nm) >= 0)
5697 return true;
5698
5699 int i;
5700 for(i=0; i<parents.size; i++) {
5701 if(parents.FastEl(i)->IgnoreMeth(nm))
5702 return true;
5703 }
5704 return false;
5705}
5706
5707bool TypeDef::is_anchor() const {
5708 return ((ptr == 0) && !ref && !DerivesFrom(TA_const)
5709 && (enum_vals.size == 0));
5710}
5711
5712bool TypeDef::is_class() const {
5713 return InheritsFormal(TA_class);
5714}
5715
5716bool TypeDef::is_enum() const {
5717 return (enum_vals.size > 0);
5718}
5719
5720MemberDef* TypeDef::FindMemberPathStatic(TypeDef*& own_td, int& net_base_off,
5721 ta_memb_ptr& net_mbr_off,
5722 const StringtaString& path, bool warn) {
5723 void* cur_base_off = NULL__null;
5724 net_mbr_off = 0;
5725 if(!own_td || path.empty()) {
5726 return NULL__null; // no warning..
5727 }
5728 StringtaString pth = path;
5729 while(pth.contains('.')) {
5730 StringtaString bef = pth.before('.');
5731 pth = pth.after('.');
5732 MemberDef* md = own_td->members.FindName(bef);
5733 if(!md) {
5734 if(warn) {
5735 taMisc::Warning("FindMemberPathStatic: member:", bef, "not found in object type:",
5736 own_td->name);
5737 }
5738 return NULL__null;
5739 }
5740 else {
5741 own_td = md->type;
5742 cur_base_off = md->GetOff(cur_base_off);
5743 net_mbr_off = *((ta_memb_ptr*)&cur_base_off);
5744 }
5745 }
5746 MemberDef* md = own_td->members.FindName(pth);
5747 if(!md) {
5748 if(warn) {
5749 taMisc::Warning("FindMemberPathStatic: member:", pth, "not found in object type:",
5750 own_td->name);
5751 }
5752 return NULL__null;
5753 }
5754 cur_base_off = md->GetOff(cur_base_off);
5755 net_mbr_off = *((ta_memb_ptr*)&cur_base_off);
5756 return md;
5757}
5758
5759EnumDef* TypeDef::FindEnum(const StringtaString& nm) const {
5760 EnumDef* rval = enum_vals.FindName(nm);
5761 if (rval) return rval;
5762
5763 for (int i = 0; i < sub_types.size; i++) {
5764 TypeDef* td = sub_types.FastEl(i);
5765 if (td->InheritsFormal(TA_enum)) {
5766 rval = td->FindEnum(nm);
5767 if (rval) return rval;
5768 }
5769 }
5770
5771 // try to look for an aka now..
5772 for (int i = 0; i < enum_vals.size; i++) {
5773 EnumDef* ed = enum_vals.FastEl(i);
5774 StringtaString aka = ed->OptionAfter("AKA_");
5775 if (aka.empty()) continue;
5776 if (aka == nm) return ed;
5777 }
5778
5779 return NULL__null;
5780}
5781
5782int TypeDef::GetEnumVal(const StringtaString& nm, StringtaString& enum_tp_nm) const {
5783 EnumDef* rval = FindEnum(nm);
5784 if (rval != NULL__null) {
5785 if ((rval->owner != NULL__null) && (rval->owner->owner != NULL__null))
5786 enum_tp_nm = rval->owner->owner->name;
5787 return rval->enum_no;
5788 }
5789 return -1;
5790}
5791
5792StringtaString TypeDef::GetEnumString(const StringtaString& enum_tp_nm, int enum_val) const {
5793 EnumDef* rval;
5794 if(enum_vals.size > 0) {
5795 rval = enum_vals.FindNo(enum_val);
5796 if(rval != NULL__null) return rval->name;
5797 }
5798 int i;
5799 for(i=0; i < sub_types.size; i++) {
5800 TypeDef* td = sub_types.FastEl(i);
5801 if(td->InheritsFormal(TA_enum) && (enum_tp_nm.empty() || (td->name == enum_tp_nm))) {
5802 rval = td->enum_vals.FindNo(enum_val);
5803 if(rval != NULL__null) return rval->name;
5804 }
5805 }
5806 return "";
5807}
5808
5809const StringtaString TypeDef::Get_C_EnumString(int enum_val, bool show_scope) const {
5810 STRING_BUF(rval, 80)taString rval(0, 80, '\0'); // extends if needed
5811
5812 // If rendering string for CSS, need to scope the enum value properly.
5813 StringtaString scope_prefix;
5814 if (show_scope) {
5815 // Enum values are scoped using the enclosing class.
5816 if (TypeDef* par_td = GetOwnerType()) {
5817 scope_prefix = par_td->GetPathName() + "::";
5818 }
5819 }
5820
5821 // If this enum type is marked #BITS, then render the set of enabled bits.
5822 if (HasOption(opt_bits)) {
5823 for (int i = 0; i < enum_vals.size; ++i) {
5824 EnumDef* ed = enum_vals[i];
5825 if (ed->HasOption("NO_BIT") || ed->HasOption("NO_SAVE")) continue;
5826 if (enum_val & ed->enum_no) {
5827 if (!rval.empty()) rval.cat("|");
5828 rval.cat(scope_prefix).cat(ed->name);
5829 }
5830 }
5831
5832 // Probably better to reutrn "0" than an empty string if no bits were set.
5833 if (!rval.empty()) {
5834 return rval;
5835 }
5836 }
5837 // Not a #BITS enum, so just look for the single value that matches.
5838 else if (EnumDef* ed = enum_vals.FindNo(enum_val)) {
5839 rval.cat(scope_prefix).cat(ed->name);
5840 return rval;
5841 }
5842
5843 // Unable to render as BITS or as value, so just spit out the raw value.
5844 // If outputting for CSS, need to provide a cast.
5845 if (show_scope) {
5846 rval.cat("((").cat(scope_prefix).cat(name).cat(")")
5847 .cat(StringtaString(enum_val)).cat(")");
5848 return rval;
5849 }
5850
5851 // Otherwise just stringify the value.
5852 return StringtaString(enum_val);
5853}
5854
5855StringtaString TypeDef::GetEnumPrefix() const {
5856 StringtaString prfx;
5857 for(int i=0;i<enum_vals.size;i++) {
5858 EnumDef* ed = enum_vals.FastEl(i);
5859 if(prfx.nonempty()) {
5860 if(ed->name.startsWith(prfx)) continue;
5861 return _nilStringtaString();
5862 }
5863 if(!ed->name.contains('_')) return _nilStringtaString();
5864 prfx = ed->name.through('_');
5865 }
5866 return prfx;
5867}
5868
5869#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
5870int TypeDef::FindTokenR(void* addr, TypeDef*& aptr) const {
5871 int rval = tokens.FindEl(addr);
5872 if (rval >= 0) {
5873 aptr = const_cast<TypeDef*>(this);
5874 return rval;
5875 }
5876
5877 // depth-first...
5878 for (int i = 0; i < children.size; i++) {
5879 rval = children.FastEl(i)->FindTokenR(addr, aptr);
5880 if (rval >= 0) return rval;
5881 }
5882 aptr = NULL__null;
5883 return -1;
5884}
5885
5886int TypeDef::FindTokenR(const char* nm, TypeDef*& aptr) const {
5887 int rval = tokens.FindNameIdx(nm);
5888 if (rval >= 0) {
5889 aptr = const_cast<TypeDef*>(this);
5890 return rval;
5891 }
5892
5893 // depth-first...
5894 for (int i = 0; i < children.size; i++) {
5895 rval = children.FastEl(i)->FindTokenR(nm, aptr);
5896 if (rval >= 0) return rval;
5897 }
5898 aptr = NULL__null;
5899 return -1;
5900}
5901#endif // ndef NO_TA_BASE
5902
5903bool TypeDef::HasEnumDefs() const {
5904 for (int i = 0; i < sub_types.size; ++i) {
5905 TypeDef* td = sub_types.FastEl(i);
5906 if (td->enum_vals.size > 0) return true;
5907 }
5908 return false;
5909}
5910
5911bool TypeDef::HasSubTypes() const {
5912 bool rval = false;
5913 for (int i = 0; i < sub_types.size; ++i) {
5914 TypeDef* td = sub_types.FastEl(i);
5915 if (td->enum_vals.size == 0) {
5916 rval = true;
5917 break;
5918 }
5919 }
5920 return rval;
5921}
5922
5923/*obs void TypeDef::Register(void* it) {
5924 if(taMisc::in_init) // don't register the instance tokens
5925 return;
5926 if((taMisc::keep_tokens != taMisc::ForceTokens) &&
5927 (!tokens.keep || (taMisc::keep_tokens == taMisc::NoTokens)))
5928 return;
5929
5930 TypeDef* par = GetParent(); // un-register from parent..
5931 int pos;
5932 if(par && (par->tokens.keep ||
5933 (taMisc::keep_tokens == taMisc::ForceTokens))
5934 && ((pos = par->tokens.FindEl(it)) >= 0))
5935 {
5936 par->tokens.RemoveIdx(pos);
5937 par->tokens.sub_tokens.ref(); // sub class got a new token..
5938 }
5939 if(par) // only register if you have a parent...
5940 tokens.Link(it);
5941}*/
5942
5943void TypeDef::RegisterFinal(void* it) {
5944 if(taMisc::in_init) // don't register the instance tokens
5945 return;
5946 if((taMisc::keep_tokens != taMisc::ForceTokens) &&
5947 (!tokens.keep || (taMisc::keep_tokens == taMisc::NoTokens)))
5948 return;
5949
5950 TypeDef* par = GetParent();
5951 if (!par) return; // we only register if have parent
5952#if defined(DEBUG) && !defined(NO_TA_BASE) // semi-TEMP, until 100% verified
5953 if (par->tokens.FindEl(it) >= 0) {
5954 StringtaString msg;
5955 msg << "attempt to reregister token of type(addr): " << ((taBase*)it)->GetTypeDef()->name << "(" << it << ")\n";
5956 taMisc::Info(msg);
5957 return;
5958 }
5959#endif
5960 tokens.Link(it);
5961 while (par) {
5962 par->tokens.sub_tokens.ref(); // sub class got a new token..
5963 par = par->GetParent();
5964 }
5965}
5966
5967bool TypeDef::ReplaceParent(TypeDef* old_tp, TypeDef* new_tp) {
5968 int anidx = parents.FindEl(old_tp);
5969 if (anidx >= 0) {
5970 parents.ReplaceLinkIdx(anidx, new_tp);
5971 name.gsub(old_tp->name, new_tp->name);
5972 return true;
5973 }
5974 bool rval = false;
5975 for (int i = 0; i < parents.size; i++) {
5976 if (parents.FastEl(i)->ReplaceParent(old_tp, new_tp)) {
5977 rval = true;
5978 name.gsub(old_tp->name, new_tp->name); // updt name at all levels
5979 }
5980 }
5981 return rval;
5982}
5983
5984void TypeDef::SetTemplType(TypeDef* templ_par, const TypeSpace& inst_pars) {
5985 if(inst_pars.size != templ_pars.size) {
5986 StringtaString defn_no(templ_pars.size);
5987 StringtaString inst_no(inst_pars.size);
5988 taMisc::Error("Template",name,"defined with",defn_no,"parameters, instantiated with",
5989 inst_no);
5990 StringtaString msg;
5991 msg << "Defined with parameters: ";
5992 templ_pars.Print(msg);
5993 msg << "\nInstantiated with parameters: ";
5994 inst_pars.Print(msg);
5995 taMisc::Error(msg);
5996 return;
5997 }
5998
5999 parents.Reset(); // bag the template's parents
6000 parents.LinkUnique(templ_par); // parent is the templ_par
6001 par_formal.RemoveEl(&TA_template);
6002 par_formal.Link(&TA_templ_inst); // now a template instantiation
6003 templ_par->children.LinkUnique(this);
6004 internal = false; // not internal any more
6005 children.Reset(); // don't have any real children..
6006
6007 // todo: need to add support for arbitrary strings here, which are not just types
6008
6009 int i;
6010 for(i=0; i<inst_pars.size; i++) {
6011 TypeDef* defn_tp = templ_par->templ_pars.FastEl(i); // type as defined
6012 TypeDef* inst_tp = inst_pars.FastEl(i); // type as instantiated
6013
6014 templ_pars.ReplaceLinkIdx(i, inst_tp); // actually replace it
6015
6016 // update sub-types based on defn_tp (go backwards to get most extended types 1st)
6017 int j;
6018 for(j=sub_types.size-1; j>=0; j--) {
6019 sub_types.FastEl(j)->ReplaceParent(defn_tp, inst_tp);
6020 }
6021 }
6022
6023 // update to use new types
6024 UpdateMDTypes(templ_par->templ_pars, templ_pars);
6025}
6026
6027/*obs void TypeDef::unRegister(void* it) {
6028 if((taMisc::keep_tokens != taMisc::ForceTokens) &&
6029 (!tokens.keep || (taMisc::keep_tokens == taMisc::NoTokens)))
6030 return;
6031
6032 if(!tokens.RemoveEl(it)) { // if we couldn't find this one, must be a sub-tok..
6033 int subt = (int)(tokens.sub_tokens) - 1;
6034 tokens.sub_tokens = MAX(subt, 0); // might blow down..
6035 }
6036}*/
6037
6038void TypeDef::unRegisterFinal(void* it) {
6039 if((taMisc::keep_tokens != taMisc::ForceTokens) &&
6040 (!tokens.keep || (taMisc::keep_tokens == taMisc::NoTokens)))
6041 return;
6042
6043 if (tokens.RemoveEl(it)) {
6044 TypeDef* par = GetParent();
6045 while (par) {
6046 par->tokens.sub_tokens.deref();
6047 par = par->GetParent();
6048 }
6049 }
6050}
6051
6052
6053//////////////////////////////////
6054// Get/SetVal //
6055//////////////////////////////////
6056
6057StringtaString TypeDef::GetValStr_enum(const void* base, void* par, MemberDef* memb_def,
6058 StrContext sc, bool force_inline) const
6059{
6060 int enval = *static_cast<const int *>(base);
6061 bool show_scope = false;
6062 return Get_C_EnumString(enval, show_scope);
6063}
6064
6065StringtaString TypeDef::GetValStr_class_inline(const void* base_, void* par, MemberDef* memb_def,
6066 StrContext sc, bool force_inline) const
6067{
6068 void* base = (void*)base_; // hack to avoid having to go through entire code below and fix
6069 StringtaString rval;
6070 if (sc != SC_DISPLAY) rval = "{";
6071 for(int i=0; i<members.size; i++) {
6072 MemberDef* md = members.FastEl(i);
6073 // if streaming, do full save check, else just check for NO_SAVE
6074 if (sc == SC_STREAMING) {
6075 if (!md->DumpMember(base))
6076 continue;
6077 } else if (sc == SC_DISPLAY) {
6078 if (!md->ShowMember(taMisc::USE_SHOW_GUI_DEF, SC_EDIT))
6079 continue;
6080 } else {
6081 if(md->HasOption("NO_SAVE"))
6082 continue;
6083 }
6084 if(sc == SC_DISPLAY) {
6085 bool condshow = md->GetCondOptTest("CONDSHOW", this, base);
6086 if(!condshow) continue;
6087 bool condedit = md->GetCondOptTest("CONDEDIT", this, base);
6088 if(!condedit) continue;
6089 bool non_def = false;
6090 if(md->GetDefaultStatus(base) == MemberDef::NOT_DEF) {
6091 non_def = true;
6092 rval += "<font style=\"background-color: yellow\">&nbsp;";
6093 }
6094 rval += md->name + "&nbsp;";
6095 if(non_def) {
6096 rval += "</font>";
6097 }
6098 if(md->type->DerivesFormal(TA_enum) || md->type->ptr > 0
6099#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
6100 || md->type->DerivesFrom(TA_taSmartPtr) || md->type->DerivesFrom(TA_taSmartRef)
6101#endif
6102 )
6103 rval += "<font style=\"background-color: LightGrey\">&nbsp;&nbsp;";
6104 else
6105 rval += "<font style=\"background-color: white\">&nbsp;&nbsp;";
6106 if(md->type->InheritsFrom(TA_taString)) rval += "\"";
6107 rval += md->type->GetValStr(md->GetOff(base), base, md, sc, force_inline);
6108 if(md->type->InheritsFrom(TA_taString)) rval += "\"";
6109 rval += "&nbsp;&nbsp;</font>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;";
6110 }
6111 else {
6112 rval += md->name + "=";
6113 if(md->type->InheritsFrom(TA_taString)) rval += "\"";
6114 rval += md->type->GetValStr(md->GetOff(base), base, md, sc, force_inline);
6115 if(md->type->InheritsFrom(TA_taString)) rval += "\"";
6116 rval += ": ";
6117 }
6118 }
6119 if (sc != SC_DISPLAY) rval += "}";
6120 return rval;
6121}
6122
6123namespace { // anonymous
6124 // Functions to format float/double values consistently across platforms.
6125
6126 void NormalizeRealString(StringtaString &str) {
6127 // Make NaN and infinity representations consistent.
6128 // Windows may use "1.#QNAN" or "-1.#IND" for nan.
6129 if (str.contains_ci("nan") || str.contains_ci("ind")) {
6130 str = "nan";
6131 return;
6132 }
6133
6134 // Windows uses "1.#INF" or "-1.#INF" for infinities.
6135 if (str.contains_ci("inf")) {
6136 str = (str.elem(0) == '-') ? "-inf" : "inf";
6137 return;
6138 }
6139
6140 // Get rid of leading zeros in the exponent, since mac/win aren't
6141 // consistent in how many they output for padding.
6142 int exponent = str.index_ci("e+");
6143 if (exponent == -1) exponent = str.index_ci("e-");
6144 if (exponent > 0) {
6145 exponent += 2;
6146 int first_non_zero = exponent;
6147 while (str.elem(first_non_zero) == '0') ++first_non_zero;
6148 if (first_non_zero > exponent) {
6149 str.del(exponent, first_non_zero - exponent);
6150 }
6151 }
6152
6153 // Convert , to . for intl contexts so files are always uniform
6154 str.repl(",", ".");
6155 }
6156
6157 StringtaString FormatFloat(float f, TypeDef::StrContext sc) {
6158 switch (sc) {
6159 case TypeDef::SC_STREAMING: {
6160 StringtaString ret(f, "%.7g");
6161 NormalizeRealString(ret);
6162 return ret;
6163 }
6164 default:
6165 return StringtaString(f);
6166 }
6167 }
6168
6169 StringtaString FormatDouble(double d, TypeDef::StrContext sc) {
6170 switch (sc) {
6171 case TypeDef::SC_STREAMING: {
6172 StringtaString ret(d, "%.16lg");
6173 NormalizeRealString(ret);
6174 return ret;
6175 }
6176 default:
6177 return StringtaString(d);
6178 }
6179 }
6180}
6181
6182StringtaString TypeDef::GetValStr(const void* base_, void* par, MemberDef* memb_def,
6183 StrContext sc, bool force_inline) const
6184{
6185 if(sc == SC_DEFAULT)
6186 sc = (taMisc::is_saving) ? SC_STREAMING : SC_VALUE;
6187 void* base = (void*)base_; // hack to avoid having to go through entire code below and fix
6188 // if its void, odds are its a function..
6189 if (InheritsFrom(TA_void) || ((memb_def != NULL__null) && (memb_def->fun_ptr != 0))) {
6190 int lidx;
6191 MethodDef* fun;
6192 if(memb_def != NULL__null)
6193 fun = TA_taRegFun.methods.FindOnListAddr(*((ta_void_fun*)base),
6194 memb_def->lists, lidx);
6195 else
6196 fun = TA_taRegFun.methods.FindAddr(*((ta_void_fun*)base), lidx);
6197 if(fun != NULL__null)
6198 return fun->name;
6199 else if(*((void**)base) == NULL__null)
6200 return StringtaString::con_NULL;
6201 return StringtaString((ta_intptr_t)*((void**)base));
6202 }
6203 if (ptr == 0) {
6204 if (DerivesFrom(TA_bool)) {
6205 bool b = *((bool*)base);
6206 switch (sc) {
6207 case SC_STREAMING: return (b) ? StringtaString::con_1 : StringtaString::con_0;
6208 case SC_DISPLAY: return (b) ? StringtaString("+") : StringtaString("-");
6209 default:
6210 return StringtaString(b);
6211 }
6212 }
6213 // note: char is generic, and typically we won't use signed char
6214 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_char)) {
6215 switch (sc) {
6216 case SC_STREAMING: return StringtaString((int)*((char*)base));
6217 default:
6218 return StringtaString(*((char*)base));
6219 }
6220 }
6221 // note: explicit use of signed char is treated like a number
6222 else if ((DerivesFrom(TA_signed_char))) {
6223 return StringtaString((int)*((signed char*)base)); // treat as numbers
6224 }
6225 // note: explicit use of unsigned char is "byte" in ta/pdp
6226 else if ((DerivesFrom(TA_unsigned_char))) {
6227 return StringtaString((uint)*((unsigned char*)base)); // treat bytes as numbers
6228 }
6229 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_short)) {
6230 return StringtaString((int)*((short*)base));
6231 }
6232 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_unsigned_short)) {
6233 return StringtaString((uint)*((unsigned short*)base));
6234 }
6235 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_int)) {
6236#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
6237 if(sc == SC_DISPLAY && par && memb_def && memb_def->HasOption("DYNENUM_ON_enum_type")) {
6238 // shameless hack to get dyn enum to display text value
6239 DynEnum* dye = (DynEnum*)par;
6240 return dye->NameVal();
6241 }
6242 else
6243#endif
6244 return StringtaString(*((int*)base));
6245 }
6246 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_unsigned_int)) {
6247 return StringtaString(*((uint*)base));
6248 }
6249 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_int64_t)) {
6250 return StringtaString(*((int64_t*)base));
6251 }
6252 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_uint64_t)) {
6253 return StringtaString(*((uint64_t*)base));
6254 }
6255 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_float)) {
6256 return FormatFloat(*static_cast<const float *>(base), sc);
6257 }
6258 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_double)) {
6259 return FormatDouble(*static_cast<const double *>(base), sc);
6260 }
6261 else if(DerivesFormal(TA_enum)) {
6262 return GetValStr_enum(base, par, memb_def, sc, force_inline);
6263 }
6264 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_taString))
6265 return *((StringtaString*)base);
6266 // in general, Variant is handled by recalling this routine on its rep's typdef
6267 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_Variant)) {
6268 TypeDef* typ;
6269 void* var_base;
6270 Variant& var = *((Variant*)base);
6271 //note: TA_void does not deal with this properly, so don't indirect...
6272 if (var.type() == Variant::T_Invalid)
6273 return _nilStringtaString();
6274 //NOTE: maybe we should indirect, rather than return NULL directly...
6275 if (var.isNull()) return StringtaString::con_NULL;
6276 var.GetRepInfo(typ, var_base);
6277 return typ->GetValStr(var_base, NULL__null, memb_def, sc, force_inline);
6278 }
6279#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
6280# ifdef TA_USE_QT1
6281 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_QAtomicInt)) {
6282 return StringtaString((int)(*((QAtomicInt*)base)));
6283 }
6284# endif
6285 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_taBase)) {
6286 taBase* rbase = (taBase*)base;
6287 if(rbase)
6288 return rbase->GetValStr(par, memb_def, sc, force_inline);
6289 }
6290 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_taArray_impl)) {
6291 taArray_impl* gp = (taArray_impl*)base;
6292 if(gp != NULL__null) {
6293 StringtaString nm = " Size: ";
6294 nm += StringtaString(gp->size);
6295 nm += StringtaString(" (") + name + ")";
6296 return nm;
6297 }
6298 return name;
6299 }
6300 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_taSmartPtr)) {
6301 // we just delegate to taBase* since we are binary compatible
6302 return TA_taBase_ptr.GetValStr(base_, par, memb_def, sc, force_inline);
6303 }
6304 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_taSmartRef)) {
6305 taSmartRef& ref = *((taSmartRef*)base);
6306 taBase* rbase = ref;
6307 if (rbase) {
6308 if ((rbase->GetOwner() != NULL__null) || (rbase == tabMisc::root)) {
6309 switch (sc) {
6310 case SC_STREAMING:
6311 return dumpMisc::path_tokens.GetPath(rbase); // use path tokens when saving..
6312 case SC_DISPLAY:
6313 return rbase->GetName();
6314 default:
6315 return rbase->GetPathNames();
6316 }
6317 } else
6318 return StringtaString((intptr_t)rbase);
6319 } else return StringtaString::con_NULL;
6320 }
6321#endif
6322 else if(DerivesFormal(TA_class) &&
6323 (force_inline || HasOption("INLINE") || HasOption("INLINE_DUMP")))
6324 {
6325 return GetValStr_class_inline(base_, par, memb_def, sc, force_inline);
6326 }
6327 else if(DerivesFormal(TA_struct))
6328 return "struct " + name;
6329 else if(DerivesFormal(TA_union))
6330 return "union " + name;
6331 else if(DerivesFormal(TA_class))
6332 return "class " + name;
6333 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_void))
6334 return "void";
6335 }
6336 else if(ptr == 1) {
6337#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
6338 if(DerivesFrom(TA_taBase)) {
6339 return taBase::GetValStr_ptr(this, base_, par, memb_def, sc, force_inline);
6340 }
6341 else
6342#endif
6343 if (DerivesFrom(TA_TypeDef)) {
6344 TypeDef* td = *((TypeDef**)base);
6345 if (td) {
6346 return td->GetPathName();
6347 } else
6348 return StringtaString::con_NULL;
6349 }
6350 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_MemberDef)) {
6351 MemberDef* md = *((MemberDef**)base);
6352 if (md) {
6353 return md->GetPathName();
6354 } else
6355 return StringtaString::con_NULL;
6356 }
6357 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_MethodDef)) {
6358 MethodDef* md = *((MethodDef**)base);
6359 if (md) {
6360 return md->GetPathName();
6361 } else
6362 return StringtaString::con_NULL;
6363 }
6364 }
6365 return name;
6366}
6367
6368void TypeDef::SetValStr_enum(const StringtaString& val, void* base, void* par, MemberDef* memb_def,
6369 StrContext sc, bool force_inline) {
6370 StringtaString strval = val;
6371 if(strval.contains(')')) {
6372 strval = strval.after(')');
6373 if(strval.empty()) // oops
6374 strval = val;
6375 }
6376 strval.gsub(" ",""); strval.gsub("\t",""); strval.gsub("\n","");
6377 if(strval.contains("::")) {
6378 StringtaString tp_nm = strval.before("::");
6379 StringtaString en_nm = strval.after("::");
6380 TypeDef* td = taMisc::FindTypeName(tp_nm);
6381 if(!td) {
6382 taMisc::Warning("Enum type name:", tp_nm, "not found in list of registered types -- cannot set value for string:", strval);
6383 return;
6384 }
6385 td->SetValStr_enum(en_nm, base, par, memb_def, sc, force_inline);
6386 return;
6387 }
6388 if(strval.contains('|')) { // bits
6389 int bits = 0;
6390 while(strval.nonempty()) {
6391 StringtaString curstr = strval;
6392 if(strval.contains('|')) {
6393 curstr = strval.before('|');
6394 strval = strval.after('|');
6395 }
6396 else
6397 strval = _nilStringtaString();
6398 EnumDef* ed = FindEnum(curstr);
6399 if(ed) {
6400 bits |= ed->enum_no;
6401 }
6402 else {
6403 taMisc::Warning("Enum named:", curstr, "not found in enum type:", name);
6404 }
6405 }
6406 *((int*)base) = bits;
6407 return;
6408 }
6409 else {
6410 EnumDef* ed = FindEnum(strval);
6411 if(ed) {
6412 *((int*)base) = ed->enum_no;
6413 return;
6414 }
6415 int intval = (int)strval;
6416 *((int*)base) = intval;
6417 return;
6418 }
6419}
6420
6421void TypeDef::SetValStr_class_inline(const StringtaString& val, void* base, void* par,
6422 MemberDef* memb_def, StrContext sc, bool force_inline) {
6423 StringtaString rval = val;
6424 rval = rval.after('{');
6425 while(rval.contains(':')) {
6426 int st_pos = rval.index('=');
6427 StringtaString mb_nm = rval.before(st_pos);
6428 StringtaString next_val = rval.after(st_pos);
6429 int pos = 0;
6430 int next_val_len = next_val.length();
6431 int c = next_val[pos];
6432 if(c == '\"') { // "
6433 st_pos++;
6434 next_val = next_val.after(0);
6435 next_val_len--;
6436 c = next_val[pos];
6437 while((c != '\"') && (pos < next_val_len)) c = next_val[++pos]; // "
6438 }
6439 else {
6440 int depth = 0;
6441 while(!(((c == ':') || (c == '}')) && (depth <= 0)) && (pos < next_val_len)) {
6442 if(c == '{') depth++;
6443 if(c == '}') depth--;
6444 c = next_val[++pos];
6445 }
6446 }
6447 StringtaString mb_val = next_val.before(pos);
6448 rval = rval.after(pos + st_pos + 1); // next position
6449 if(c == '\"') // "
6450 rval = rval.after(':'); // skip the semi-colon which was not groked
6451 mb_nm.gsub(" ", "");
6452 MemberDef* md = members.FindName(mb_nm);
6453 if(md == NULL__null) { // try to find a name with an aka..
6454 int a;
6455 for(a=0;a<members.size;a++) {
6456 MemberDef* amd = members.FastEl(a);
6457 StringtaString aka = amd->OptionAfter("AKA_");
6458 if(aka.empty()) continue;
6459 if(aka == mb_nm) {
6460 md = amd;
6461 break;
6462 }
6463 }
6464 }
6465 if((md != NULL__null) && !mb_val.empty()) { // note: changed par to base here..
6466 md->type->SetValStr(mb_val, md->GetOff(base), base /* par */, md, sc, true);
6467 // force inline!
6468 }
6469 }
6470}
6471
6472void TypeDef::SetValStr(const StringtaString& val, void* base, void* par, MemberDef* memb_def,
6473 StrContext sc, bool force_inline)
6474{
6475 if (sc == SC_DEFAULT)
6476 sc = (taMisc::is_loading) ? SC_STREAMING : SC_VALUE;
6477
6478 if(InheritsFrom(TA_void) || ((memb_def != NULL__null) && (memb_def->fun_ptr != 0))) {
6479 MethodDef* fun = TA_taRegFun.methods.FindName(val);
6480 if((fun != NULL__null) && (fun->addr != NULL__null))
6481 *((ta_void_fun*)base) = fun->addr;
6482 return;
6483 }
6484 if (ptr == 0) {
6485 if(DerivesFrom(TA_bool)) {
6486 *((bool*)base) = val.toBool();
6487 }
6488 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_int))
6489 *((int*)base) = val.toInt();
6490 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_float))
6491 *((float*)base) = val.toFloat();
6492 else if(DerivesFormal(TA_enum)) {
6493 SetValStr_enum(val, base, par, memb_def, sc, force_inline);
6494 }
6495 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_taString))
6496 *((StringtaString*)base) = val;
6497 // in general, Variant is handled by recalling this routine on its rep's typdef, then fixing null
6498 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_Variant)) {
6499 TypeDef* typ;
6500 void* var_base;
6501 Variant& var = *((Variant*)base);
6502 // if it doesn't have a type, then it will just become a string
6503 // (we can't let TA_void get processed...)
6504 if (var.type() == Variant::T_Invalid) {
6505 // don't do anything for empty string
6506 if (!val.empty())
6507 var = val;
6508 return;
6509 }
6510 var.GetRepInfo(typ, var_base);
6511 typ->SetValStr(val, var_base, par, memb_def, sc, force_inline);
6512 var.UpdateAfterLoad();
6513 }
6514 // note: char is treated as an ansi character
6515 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_char))
6516 //TODO: char conversion heuristics
6517 *((char*)base) = val.toChar();
6518 // signed char is treated like a number
6519 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_signed_char))
6520 *((signed char*)base) = (signed char)val.toShort();
6521 // unsigned char is "byte" in ta/pdp and treated like a number
6522 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_unsigned_char))
6523 *((unsigned char*)base) = (unsigned char)val.toUShort();
6524 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_short))
6525 *((short*)base) = val.toShort();
6526 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_unsigned_short))
6527 *((unsigned short*)base) = val.toUShort();
6528 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_unsigned_int))
6529 *((uint*)base) = val.toUInt();
6530 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_int64_t))
6531 *((int64_t*)base) = val.toInt64();
6532 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_uint64_t))
6533 *((uint64_t*)base) = val.toUInt64();
6534 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_double))
6535 *((double*)base) = val.toDouble();
6536#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
6537# ifdef TA_USE_QT1
6538 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_QAtomicInt)) {
6539 (*((QAtomicInt*)base)) = val.toInt();
6540 }
6541# endif
6542 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_taBase)) {
6543 taBase* rbase = (taBase*)base;
6544 if(rbase)
6545 rbase->SetValStr(val, par, memb_def, sc, force_inline);
6546 }
6547 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_taArray_impl)) {
6548 taArray_impl* gp = (taArray_impl*)base;
6549 if(gp != NULL__null)
6550 gp->InitFromString(val);
6551 }
6552 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_taSmartPtr)) {
6553 // we just delegate, since we are binary compat
6554 TA_taBase_ptr.SetValStr(val, base, par, memb_def, sc, force_inline);
6555 return;
6556 }
6557 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_taSmartRef) && (tabMisc::root)) {
6558 taBase* bs = NULL__null;
6559 if ((val != StringtaString::con_NULL) && (val != "Null")) {
6560 StringtaString tmp_val(val); // FindFromPath can change it
6561 if (sc == SC_STREAMING) {
6562 bs = dumpMisc::path_tokens.FindFromPath(tmp_val, this, base, par, memb_def);
6563 if (!bs)return; // indicates deferred
6564 } else {
6565 MemberDef* md = NULL__null;
6566 bs = tabMisc::root->FindFromPath(tmp_val, md);
6567 if(!bs) {
6568 taMisc::Warning("*** Invalid Path in SetValStr:",val);
6569 return;
6570 }
6571 if(md) {
6572 if (md->type->ptr == 1) {
6573 bs = *((taBase**)bs);
6574 if(bs == NULL__null) {
6575 taMisc::Warning("*** Null object at end of path in SetValStr:",val);
6576 return;
6577 }
6578 } else if(md->type->ptr != 0) {
6579 taMisc::Warning("*** ptr count greater than 1 in path:", val);
6580 return;
6581 }
6582 }
6583 }
6584 }
6585 taSmartRef& ref = *((taSmartRef*)base);
6586 ref = bs;
6587 }
6588#endif
6589 else if(DerivesFormal(TA_class) &&
6590 (force_inline || HasOption("INLINE") || HasOption("INLINE_DUMP"))) {
6591 SetValStr_class_inline(val, base, par, memb_def, sc, force_inline);
6592 }
6593 }
6594 else if(ptr == 1) {
6595 bool is_null = ((val == "NULL") || (val == "(NULL)"));
6596#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
6597 if (DerivesFrom(TA_taBase)) {
6598 if (tabMisc::root) {
6599 if (is_null)
6600 taBase::DelPointer((taBase**)base);
6601 else
6602 taBase::SetValStr_ptr(val, this, base, par, memb_def, sc, force_inline);
6603 }
6604 }
6605 else
6606#endif
6607 if (is_null) {
6608 *((void**)base) = NULL__null;
6609 }
6610 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_TypeDef)) {
6611 TypeDef* td = taMisc::types.FindTypeR(val);
6612 if(td != NULL__null)
6613 *((TypeDef**)base) = td;
6614 }
6615 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_MemberDef)) {
6616 StringtaString fqtypnm = val.before("::", -1); // before final ::
6617 StringtaString mbnm = val.after("::", -1); // after final ::
6618 if(!fqtypnm.empty() && !mbnm.empty()) {
6619 TypeDef* td = taMisc::types.FindTypeR(fqtypnm);
6620 if(td != NULL__null) {
6621 MemberDef* md = td->members.FindName(mbnm);
6622 if(md != NULL__null)
6623 *((MemberDef**)base) = md;
6624 }
6625 }
6626 }
6627 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_MethodDef)) {
6628 StringtaString fqtypnm = val.before("::", -1); // before final ::
6629 StringtaString mthnm = val.after("::", -1);
6630 if(!fqtypnm.empty() && !mthnm.empty()) {
6631 TypeDef* td = taMisc::types.FindTypeR(fqtypnm);
6632 if(td != NULL__null) {
6633 MethodDef* md = td->methods.FindName(mthnm);
6634 if(md != NULL__null)
6635 *((MethodDef**)base) = md;
6636 }
6637 }
6638 }
6639 }
6640}
6641
6642int TypeDef::ReplaceValStr_class(const StringtaString& srch, const StringtaString& repl, const StringtaString& mbr_filt,
6643 void* base, void* par, TypeDef* par_typ, MemberDef* memb_def,
6644 StrContext sc)
6645{
6646 int rval = 0;
6647 for(int i=0; i<members.size; i++) {
6648 MemberDef* md = members.FastEl(i);
6649 // if streaming, do full save check, else just check for NO_SAVE
6650 if (sc == SC_STREAMING) {
6651 if (!md->DumpMember(base))
6652 continue;
6653 } else if (sc == SC_DISPLAY) {
6654 if (!md->ShowMember(taMisc::USE_SHOW_GUI_DEF, SC_EDIT))
6655 continue;
6656 } else {
6657 if(md->HasOption("NO_SAVE"))
6658 continue;
6659 }
6660 if(sc == SC_DISPLAY) {
6661 bool condshow = md->GetCondOptTest("CONDSHOW", this, base);
6662 if(!condshow) continue;
6663 bool condedit = md->GetCondOptTest("CONDEDIT", this, base);
6664 if(!condedit) continue;
6665 }
6666 rval += md->type->ReplaceValStr(srch, repl, mbr_filt, md->GetOff(base), base, this, md, sc);
6667 }
6668 return rval;
6669}
6670
6671int TypeDef::ReplaceValStr(const StringtaString& srch, const StringtaString& repl, const StringtaString& mbr_filt,
6672 void* base, void* par, TypeDef* par_typ, MemberDef* memb_def,
6673 StrContext sc)
6674{
6675 if(ptr == 0) {
6676#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
6677 if(DerivesFrom(TA_taBase)) {
6678 taBase* rbase = (taBase*)base;
6679 if(rbase)
6680 return rbase->ReplaceValStr(srch, repl, mbr_filt, par, par_typ, memb_def, sc);
6681 }
6682 else
6683#endif
6684 if(DerivesFormal(TA_class) &&
6685 !(DerivesFrom(TA_taString) || DerivesFrom(TA_Variant)
6686#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
6687 || DerivesFrom(TA_QAtomicInt) || DerivesFrom(TA_taArray_impl)
6688 || DerivesFrom(TA_taSmartPtr) || DerivesFrom(TA_taSmartRef)
6689#endif
6690 )
6691 )
6692 {
6693 return ReplaceValStr_class(srch, repl, mbr_filt, base, par, par_typ, memb_def, sc);
6694 }
6695 }
6696 // only apply filtering to the terminal leaves case here, not to higher level owners
6697 if(memb_def && mbr_filt.nonempty() && !memb_def->name.contains(mbr_filt))
6698 return 0;
6699 StringtaString str = GetValStr(base, par, memb_def, sc, false);
6700 // note: just using literal replace here, not regexp..
6701 if(!str.contains(srch)) return 0;
6702 StringtaString orig = str;
6703 int rval = str.gsub(srch, repl);
6704 SetValStr(str, base, par, memb_def, sc, false);
6705 StringtaString repl_info = StringtaString("orig val: ") + orig + " new val: " + str;
6706#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
6707 if(par_typ && par && par_typ->DerivesFrom(TA_taBase)) {
6708 if(memb_def) {
6709 taMisc::Info("Replaced string value in member:", memb_def->name, "of type:", name,
6710 "in", par_typ->name, "object:",((taBase*)par)->GetPathNames(),repl_info);
6711 }
6712 else {
6713 taMisc::Info("Replaced string value in type:", name, "in", par_typ->name, "object:",
6714 ((taBase*)par)->GetPathNames(), repl_info);
6715 }
6716 }
6717 else
6718#endif
6719 {
6720 if(memb_def) {
6721 taMisc::Info("Replaced string value in member:", memb_def->name, "of type:", name,
6722 repl_info);
6723 }
6724 else {
6725 taMisc::Info("Replaced string value in type:", name, repl_info);
6726 }
6727 }
6728 return rval;
6729}
6730
6731bool TypeDef::isVarCompat() const {
6732 // a few "blockers"
6733 if (ref || (ptr > 1) || InheritsFrom(TA_void)) return false;
6734#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
6735 if ((ptr ==1) && !InheritsFrom(TA_taBase)) return false;
6736#endif
6737 if (InheritsNonAtomicClass()) return false;
6738 // ok, hopefully the rest are ok!
6739 return true;
6740}
6741
6742const Variant TypeDef::GetValVar(const void* base_, const MemberDef* memb_def) const
6743{
6744 void* base = (void*)base_; // hack to avoid having to go through entire code below and fix
6745 // if its void, odds are its a function..
6746 if (InheritsFrom(TA_void) || ((memb_def) && (memb_def->fun_ptr != 0))) {
6747 int lidx;
6748 MethodDef* fun;
6749 if(memb_def != NULL__null)
6750 fun = TA_taRegFun.methods.FindOnListAddr(*((ta_void_fun*)base),
6751 memb_def->lists, lidx);
6752 else
6753 fun = TA_taRegFun.methods.FindAddr(*((ta_void_fun*)base), lidx);
6754 if (fun != NULL__null)
6755 return fun->name;
6756 else if(*((void**)base) == NULL__null)
6757 return Variant((void*)NULL__null);//String::con_NULL;
6758 else
6759 return StringtaString((ta_intptr_t)*((void**)base)); //TODO: is this the best??
6760 }
6761 if (ptr == 0) {
6762 if (DerivesFrom(TA_bool)) {
6763 bool b = *((bool*)base);
6764 return b; //T_Bool
6765 }
6766 // note: char is generic char, and typically we won't use signed char
6767 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_char)) {
6768 return *((char*)base); // T_Char
6769 }
6770 // note: explicit use of signed char is treated like a number
6771 else if ((DerivesFrom(TA_signed_char))) {
6772 return (int)*((signed char*)base); // T_Int
6773 }
6774 // note: explicit use of unsigned char is "byte" in ta/pdp
6775 else if ((DerivesFrom(TA_unsigned_char))) {
6776 return (uint)*((unsigned char*)base); // T_UInt
6777 }
6778 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_short)) {
6779 return (int)*((short*)base); // T_Int
6780 }
6781 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_unsigned_short)) {
6782 return (uint)*((unsigned short*)base); // T_UInt
6783 }
6784 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_int)) {
6785 return *((int*)base); // T_Int
6786 }
6787 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_unsigned_int)) {
6788 return *((uint*)base); // T_UInt
6789 }
6790 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_int64_t)) {
6791 return *((int64_t*)base); // T_Int64
6792 }
6793 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_uint64_t)) {
6794 return *((uint64_t*)base); // T_UInt64
6795 }
6796 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_float)) {
6797 return *((float*)base); // T_Double
6798 }
6799 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_double)) {
6800 return *((double*)base); // T_Double
6801 }
6802 else if(DerivesFormal(TA_enum)) {
6803 int en_val = *((int*)base);
6804 StringtaString rval = GetEnumString("", en_val);
6805 if(rval.empty()) rval = (StringtaString)en_val;
6806 return rval; // T_String
6807 }
6808 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_taString))
6809 return *((StringtaString*)base); // T_String
6810 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_Variant)) {
6811 return *((Variant*)base);
6812 }
6813#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
6814 //WARNING: there could be ref-count issues if base has not been ref'ed at least once!
6815 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_taBase)) {
6816 taBase* rbase = (taBase*)base;
6817 //WARNING: there could be ref-count issues if base has not been ref'ed at least once!
6818 return rbase; // T_Base
6819 }
6820 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_taSmartPtr)) {
6821 taBase* rbase = (taBase*)base;
6822 return rbase; // T_Base
6823 }
6824 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_taSmartRef)) {
6825 taBase* rbase = *((taSmartRef*)base);
6826 return rbase; // T_Base
6827 }
6828#endif
6829 // NOTE: other value types are not really supported, just fall through to return invalid
6830 }
6831 else if (ptr == 1) {
6832 if (DerivesFrom(TA_char)) {
6833 return *((char**)base); // T_String
6834 }
6835#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
6836 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_taBase)) {
6837 //NOTE: strictly speaking, we should be returning a generic ptr which points to the
6838 // base value, but in practice, this is never what we want, since members that
6839 // are taBase*'s are ubiquitous, what we actually want is a reference to the thing
6840 // being pointed to, ie., the content of the variable
6841 taBase* rbase = *((taBase**)base);
6842 return rbase; // T_Base
6843 }
6844#endif
6845 }
6846 // other types and degress of indirection not really supported
6847 return _nilVariantVariant();
6848}
6849
6850bool TypeDef::ValIsDefault(const void* base, const MemberDef* memb_def,
6851 int for_show) const
6852{
6853 // some cases are simple, for non-class values
6854 if ((InheritsFrom(TA_void) || ((memb_def) && (memb_def->fun_ptr != 0))) ||
6855 (ptr > 0) ||
6856 !InheritsNonAtomicClass()
6857 ){
6858 return ValIsEmpty(base, memb_def); // note: show not used for single guy
6859 } else { // instance of a class, so must recursively determine
6860 // just find all eligible guys, and return true if none fail
6861 for (int i = 0; i < members.size; ++i) {
6862 MemberDef* md = members.FastEl(i);
6863 if (!md || !md->ShowMember(taMisc::USE_SHOW_GUI_DEF, TypeItem::SC_ANY,
6864 for_show)) continue;
6865 if (!md->ValIsDefault(base, for_show))
6866 return false;
6867 }
6868 return true;
6869 }
6870}
6871
6872bool TypeDef::ValIsEmpty(const void* base_, const MemberDef* memb_def) const
6873{
6874 void* base = (void*)base_; // hack to avoid having to go through entire code below and fix
6875 // if its void, odds are its a function..
6876 if (InheritsFrom(TA_void) || ((memb_def) && (memb_def->fun_ptr != 0))) {
6877 int lidx;
6878 MethodDef* fun;
6879 if(memb_def != NULL__null)
6880 fun = TA_taRegFun.methods.FindOnListAddr(*((ta_void_fun*)base),
6881 memb_def->lists, lidx);
6882 else
6883 fun = TA_taRegFun.methods.FindAddr(*((ta_void_fun*)base), lidx);
6884 if (fun)
6885 return false;
6886 else
6887 return !(*((void**)base));
6888 }
6889 if (ptr == 0) {
6890 if (DerivesFrom(TA_bool)) {
6891 bool b = *((bool*)base);
6892 return !b; //T_Bool
6893 }
6894 // note: char is generic char, and typically we won't use signed char
6895 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_char)) {
6896 return (*((char*)base) == '\0');
6897 }
6898 // note: explicit use of signed char is treated like a number
6899 else if ((DerivesFrom(TA_signed_char))) {
6900 return (*((signed char*)base) == 0);
6901 }
6902 // note: explicit use of unsigned char is "byte" in ta/pdp
6903 else if ((DerivesFrom(TA_unsigned_char))) {
6904 return (*((unsigned char*)base) == 0);
6905 }
6906 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_short)) {
6907 return (*((short*)base) == 0);
6908 }
6909 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_unsigned_short)) {
6910 return (*((unsigned short*)base) == 0);
6911 }
6912 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_int)) {
6913 return (*((int*)base) == 0);
6914 }
6915 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_unsigned_int)) {
6916 return (*((uint*)base) == 0);
6917 }
6918 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_int64_t)) {
6919 return (*((int64_t*)base) == 0);
6920 }
6921 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_uint64_t)) {
6922 return (*((uint64_t*)base) == 0); // T_UInt64
6923 }
6924 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_float)) {
6925 return (*((float*)base) == 0); // T_Double
6926 }
6927 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_double)) {
6928 return (*((double*)base) == 0); // T_Double
6929 }
6930 else if(DerivesFormal(TA_enum)) {
6931 return (*((int*)base) == 0); // T_Int
6932 }
6933 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_taString))
6934 return ((*((StringtaString*)base)).empty()); // T_String
6935 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_Variant)) {
6936 return ((*((Variant*)base)).isDefault());
6937 }
6938#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
6939 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_taSmartPtr)) {
6940 taBase* rbase = (taBase*)base;
6941 return !(rbase); // T_Base
6942 }
6943 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_taSmartRef)) {
6944 taBase* rbase = *((taSmartRef*)base);
6945 return !(rbase); // T_Base
6946 }
6947#endif
6948 // must be some other value or a class -- default to saying no to empty
6949 else return false;
6950 // NOTE: other value types are not really supported, just fall through to return invalid
6951 }
6952 else // (ptr >= 1)
6953 return !(*((void**)base)); // only empty if NULL
6954}
6955
6956void TypeDef::SetValVar(const Variant& val, void* base, void* par,
6957 MemberDef* memb_def)
6958{
6959 if(InheritsFrom(TA_void) || ((memb_def != NULL__null) && (memb_def->fun_ptr != 0))) {
6960 MethodDef* fun = TA_taRegFun.methods.FindName(val.toString());
6961 if((fun != NULL__null) && (fun->addr != NULL__null))
6962 *((ta_void_fun*)base) = fun->addr;
6963 return;
6964 }
6965 if (ptr == 0) {
6966 if(DerivesFrom(TA_bool)) {
6967 *((bool*)base) = val.toBool(); return;
6968 }
6969 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_int)) {
6970 *((int*)base) = val.toInt(); return;}
6971 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_float)) {
6972 *((float*)base) = val.toFloat(); return;}
6973 else if(DerivesFormal(TA_enum)) {
6974 // if it is a number, assume direct value, otherwise it is a string
6975 if (val.isNumeric()) {
6976 *((int*)base) = val.toInt();
6977 return;
6978 }
6979 SetValStr_enum(val.toString(), base, par, memb_def);
6980 }
6981 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_taString)) {
6982 *((StringtaString*)base) = val.toString(); return;}
6983 // in general, Variant is handled by recalling this routine on its rep's typdef, then fixing null
6984 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_Variant)) {
6985 *((Variant*)base) = val; return;
6986 }
6987 // note: char is treated as an ansi character
6988 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_char)) {
6989 //TODO: char conversion heuristics
6990 *((char*)base) = val.toChar(); return;}
6991 // signed char is treated like a number
6992 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_signed_char)) {
6993 *((signed char*)base) = (signed char)val.toInt(); return;}
6994 // unsigned char is "byte" in ta/pdp and treated like a number
6995 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_unsigned_char)) {
6996 *((unsigned char*)base) = val.toByte(); return;}
6997 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_short)) {
6998 *((short*)base) = (short)val.toInt(); return;}
6999 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_unsigned_short)) {
7000 *((unsigned short*)base) = (unsigned short)val.toUInt(); return;}
7001 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_unsigned_int)) {
7002 *((uint*)base) = val.toUInt(); return;}
7003 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_int64_t)) {
7004 *((int64_t*)base) = val.toInt64(); return;}
7005 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_uint64_t)) {
7006 *((uint64_t*)base) = val.toUInt64(); return;}
7007 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_double)) {
7008 *((double*)base) = val.toDouble(); return;}
7009#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
7010 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_taList_impl)) {
7011 //TODO: not handled!
7012 }
7013 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_taArray_base)) {
7014 taArray_base* gp = (taArray_base*)base;
7015 if(gp != NULL__null)
7016 gp->InitFromString(val.toString());
7017 return;
7018 }
7019 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_taArray_impl)) {
7020 taArray_impl* gp = (taArray_impl*)base;
7021 if (gp != NULL__null) {
7022 gp->InitFromString(val.toString());
7023 }
7024 return;
7025 }
7026 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_taSmartPtr)) {
7027 // we just delegate, since we are binary compat
7028 TA_taBase_ptr.SetValVar(val, base, par, memb_def);
7029 return;
7030 }
7031 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_taSmartRef)) {
7032 //VERY DANGEROUS!!!! No type checking!!!!
7033 taSmartRef& ref = *((taSmartRef*)base);
7034 ref = val.toBase();
7035 return;
7036 }
7037#endif
7038 }
7039 else if(ptr == 1) {
7040#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
7041 if (DerivesFrom(TA_taBase)) {
7042 taBase* bs = val.toBase();
7043 if (bs && !bs->GetTypeDef()->DerivesFrom(this)) {
7044 taMisc::Warning("Attempt to set member of type", this->name, " from ",
7045 bs->GetTypeDef()->name);
7046 return;
7047
7048 }
7049 if (memb_def && memb_def->HasOption("OWN_POINTER")) {
7050 if(par == NULL__null)
7051 taMisc::Warning("*** NULL parent for owned pointer:");
7052 else
7053 taBase::OwnPointer((taBase**)base, bs, (taBase*)par);
7054 }
7055 else {
7056 if (memb_def && memb_def->HasOption("NO_SET_POINTER"))
7057 (*(taBase**)base) = bs;
7058 else
7059 taBase::SetPointer((taBase**)base, bs);
7060 }
7061 return;
7062 }
7063#endif
7064 }
7065 // if we get to here, the value can't be assigned
7066 taMisc::Warning("Type value was not assigned from Variant.");
7067}
7068
7069
7070#if !defined(NO_TA_BASE) && defined(DMEM_COMPILE)
7071#define DMEM_TYPE (*(MPI_Datatype_PArray*)(dmem_type))
7072void TypeDef::AssertDMem_Type() {
7073 if (dmem_type) return;
7074 dmem_type = new MPI_Datatype_PArray;
7075}
7076
7077MPI_Datatype TypeDef::GetDMemType(int share_set) {
7078 AssertDMem_Type();
7079 if(DMEM_TYPE.size > share_set) return DMEM_TYPE[share_set];
7080 if(DMEM_TYPE.size < share_set) GetDMemType(share_set-1);
7081
7082 MPI_Datatype primitives[members.size];
7083 MPI_Aint byte_offsets[members.size];
7084 int block_lengths[members.size];
7085
7086 int curr_prim = 0;
7087 for (int m = 0; m < members.size; m++) {
7088 MemberDef* md = members.FastEl(m);
7089 StringtaString shrset = md->OptionAfter("DMEM_SHARE_SET_");
7090 if(shrset.empty()) continue;
7091 if (md->type->ptr > 0) {
7092 if(taMisc::dmem_proc == 0) {
7093 taMisc::Error("WARNING: DMEM_SHARE_SET Specified for a pointer.",
7094 "Pointers can not be shared.");
7095 continue;
7096 }
7097 }
7098 if (md->type->InheritsFormal(TA_class)) {
7099 primitives[curr_prim] = md->type->GetDMemType(share_set);
7100 }
7101 else if (md->type->InheritsFrom(TA_double)) {
7102 primitives[curr_prim] = MPI_DOUBLE;
7103 }
7104 else if (md->type->InheritsFrom(TA_float)) {
7105 primitives[curr_prim] = MPI_FLOAT;
7106 }
7107 else if (md->type->InheritsFrom(TA_int)) {
7108 primitives[curr_prim] = MPI_INT;
7109 }
7110 else if (md->type->InheritsFrom(TA_enum)) {
7111 primitives[curr_prim] = MPI_INT;
7112 }
7113 else if (md->type->InheritsFrom(TA_long)) {
7114 primitives[curr_prim] = MPI_LONG;
7115 }
7116 else {
7117 taMisc::Error("WARNING: DMEM_SHARE_SET Specified for an unrecognized type.",
7118 "unrecoginized types can not be shared.");
7119 continue;
7120 }
7121
7122 byte_offsets[curr_prim] = (ulong)md->GetOff((void *)0x100) - 0x100;
7123 block_lengths[curr_prim] = 1;
7124 curr_prim++;
7125 }
7126 MPI_Datatype new_type;
7127 if (!curr_prim) {
7128 new_type = MPI_DATATYPE_NULL;
7129 taMisc::Error("Null type, set:", StringtaString(share_set),", type:",name);
7130 }
7131 else {
7132 MPI_Type_struct(curr_prim, block_lengths, byte_offsets, primitives, &new_type);
7133 MPI_Type_commit(&new_type);
7134 }
7135 DMEM_TYPE.Add(new_type);
7136 return new_type;
7137}
7138
7139#endif
7140
7141//////////////////////////////////
7142// CopyFromSameType //
7143//////////////////////////////////
7144
7145void MemberSpace::CopyFromSameType(void* trg_base, void* src_base) {
7146 int i;
7147 for(i=0; i<size; i++) {
7148 MemberDef* md = FastEl(i);
7149 if(!md->HasOption("NO_COPY"))
7150 md->CopyFromSameType(trg_base, src_base);
7151 }
7152}
7153
7154void MemberSpace::CopyOnlySameType(void* trg_base, void* src_base) {
7155 int i;
7156 for(i=0; i<size; i++) {
7157 MemberDef* md = FastEl(i);
7158 if((md->owner == this) && !md->HasOption("NO_COPY")) // only same type provision
7159 md->CopyFromSameType(trg_base, src_base); // then copy whole thing..
7160 }
7161}
7162
7163void MemberDef::CopyFromSameType(void* trg_base, void* src_base) {
7164 type->CopyFromSameType(GetOff(trg_base), GetOff(src_base), this);
7165}
7166
7167void MemberDef::CopyOnlySameType(void* trg_base, void* src_base) {
7168 type->CopyOnlySameType(GetOff(trg_base), GetOff(src_base), this);
7169}
7170
7171void TypeDef::CopyFromSameType(void* trg_base, void* src_base,
7172 MemberDef* memb_def)
7173{
7174 // if its void, odds are it is a fun pointer
7175 if(InheritsFrom(TA_void) || ((memb_def != NULL__null) && (memb_def->fun_ptr != 0))) {
7176 int lidx;
7177 MethodDef* fun;
7178 if(memb_def != NULL__null)
7179 fun = TA_taRegFun.methods.FindOnListAddr(*((ta_void_fun*)src_base),
7180 memb_def->lists, lidx);
7181 else
7182 fun = TA_taRegFun.methods.FindAddr(*((ta_void_fun*)src_base), lidx);
7183 if((fun != NULL__null) || (memb_def != NULL__null))
7184 *((ta_void_fun*)trg_base) = *((ta_void_fun*)src_base); // must be a funptr
7185 else
7186 *((void**)trg_base) = *((void**)src_base); // otherwise just a voidptr
7187 return;
7188 }
7189 if (ptr == 0) {
7190 // internal types can simply be bit copied
7191 if (internal) {
7192 memcpy(trg_base, src_base, size);
7193 }
7194 else if(DerivesFormal(&TA_enum)) {
7195 memcpy(trg_base, src_base, size); // bit copy
7196 }
7197 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_Variant))
7198 *((Variant*)trg_base) = *((Variant*)src_base);
7199 else if (DerivesFrom(TA_taString))
7200 *((StringtaString*)trg_base) = *((StringtaString*)src_base);
7201#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
7202 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_taSmartRef))
7203 *((taSmartRef*)trg_base) = *((taSmartRef*)src_base);
7204 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_taSmartPtr))
7205 *((taSmartPtr*)trg_base) = *((taSmartPtr*)src_base);
7206 else if(DerivesFrom(TA_taBase)) {
7207 taBase* rbase = (taBase*)trg_base;
7208 taBase* sbase = (taBase*)src_base;
7209 if(sbase->InheritsFrom(rbase->GetTypeDef()) || rbase->InheritsFrom(sbase->GetTypeDef())) // makin it safe..
7210 rbase->UnSafeCopy(sbase);
7211 }
7212#endif
7213 else if(DerivesFormal(TA_class))
7214 members.CopyFromSameType(trg_base, src_base);
7215 }
7216 else if(ptr >= 1) {
7217#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
7218 if((ptr == 1) && DerivesFrom(TA_taBase)) {
7219 taBase** rbase = (taBase**)trg_base;
7220 taBase** sbase = (taBase**)src_base;
7221 taBase::SetPointer(rbase, *sbase);
7222 }
7223 else {
7224#endif
7225 *((void**)trg_base) = *((void**)src_base);
7226#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
7227 }
7228#endif
7229 }
7230}
7231
7232void TypeDef::CopyOnlySameType(void* trg_base, void* src_base,
7233 MemberDef* memb_def)
7234{
7235 if(InheritsFormal(TA_class)) {
7236#ifndef NO_TA_BASE
7237 if(InheritsFrom(TA_taBase)) {
7238 taBase* src = (taBase*)src_base;
